inventarium: <entryFree id="n24718" type="main" key="inventa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>invenio</etym>, <sense id="n24718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventory</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1" default="NO">27, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:15 al" default="NO">42, 5, 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
inventio: <entryFree id="n24719" type="main" key="inventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inventing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invention</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24719.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa vis quae investigat occulta, quae inventio atque excogitatio dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:72" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24719.2" n="II" level="1"> Rhet., <hi rend="ital">the faculty of invention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventio est excogitatio rerum verarum aut verisimilium, quae causam probabilem reddant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partes eae (rhetoricae artis) . . . inventio, dispositio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inventiuncula: <entryFree id="n24720" type="main" key="inventi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>inventio</etym>, <sense id="n24720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trifling invention</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">minimis inventiunculis gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inventor: <entryFree id="n24721" type="main" key="inventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>invenio</etym>, <sense id="n24721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that finds out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contriver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discoverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">o mearum voluptatum omnium Inventor, inceptor, perfector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristaeus, qui olivae dicitur inventor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:164 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 164 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventor legis Volero,</quote> <trans><tr>proposer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum,</quote> <trans><tr>founder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes inventoribus afferunt laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:23" default="NO">8, 6, 23</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inventrix: <entryFree id="n24722" type="main" key="inventrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inventor</etym>, <sense id="n24722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that finds out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inventress</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnium doctrinarum inventrices Athenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminis hujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:709" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 709</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inventum: <entryFree id="n24723" type="main" key="inventum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>invenio</etym>, <sense id="n24723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a device</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrivance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invention</hi> (class.): ut te omnes di <pb n="994" /> <cb n="INVE" /> cum istoc invento atque incepto perduint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventa Zenonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventum medicina meum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium, litterarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima inventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inventus: <entryFree id="n24724" type="main" key="inventus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from invenio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24725" type="main" key="inventus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, only in <sense id="n24725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> [invenio], <hi rend="ital">an invention</hi> (for inventio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invenuste: <entryFree id="n24726" type="main" key="inve^nuste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĕnustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. invenustus <sense id="n24726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invenustus: <entryFree id="n24727" type="main" key="inve^nustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕnustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24727.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not elegant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">graceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unattractive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scortillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non invenustus actor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:237" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:37" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 37</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24727.1" n="II" level="1"> (Without Venus, i. e.) <hi rend="ital">Unfortunate in love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenustae sine munditia et sumptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo invenustus aut infelix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit> Don. ad loc.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕnustē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">not elegantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungracefully</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non invenuste dici videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; App. de Mundo, p. 70.</sense></entryFree>
inverecunde: <entryFree id="n24728" type="main" key="inve^re_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĕrēcundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inverecundus <sense id="n24728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inverecundia: <entryFree id="n24729" type="main" key="inve^re_cundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĕrēcundĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inverecundus</etym>, <sense id="n24729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shamelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immodesty</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 7</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:456" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 456</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inverecundus: <entryFree id="n24730" type="main" key="inve^re_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕrēcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (inverĕcundus, Ven. de Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:393" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 393</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immodest.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24730.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">impudens, impurus, inverecundissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 13</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24730.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: animi ingenium, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:45:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 45, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 15</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">neutr, sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inverecundum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is shameful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid inverecundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĕ-rēcundē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamelessly</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua aetas fuerit, quae translationis jure uteretur inverecunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatorum parietes, aedibus sacris inverecunde conexi,</quote> <trans><tr>irreverently</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 128, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 155:3:section=11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 155, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invergo: <entryFree id="n24731" type="main" key="invergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vergo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to incline</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour upon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. infundo): liquores in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carchesia lactis, mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 246</bibl></cit> and 247: <cit><quote lang="la">fronti vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:611" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 611</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inverisimilis: <entryFree id="n24732" type="main" key="inve_ri^si^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vērĭsĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>2. in</etym>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">improbable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not plausible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 715</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
inversio: <entryFree id="n24733" type="main" key="inversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inverto</etym>, <sense id="n24733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inversion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24733.1" n="I" level="1"> Verborum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an ironical inversion of meaning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65</bibl>. 261.—</sense><sense id="n24733.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An allegory</hi>, transl. of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)llhgori/a,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24733.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A transposition</hi>, i. q. <foreign lang="greek">a)nastrofh/</foreign> (as quoque ego for ego quoque), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inversor: <entryFree id="n24734" type="hapax" key="inversor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-versor</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n24734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be occupied about</hi> (ante-class.): quīs inversamur, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl> (perh. quīs in versamur).</sense></entryFree>
inversum: <entryFree id="n24735" type="main" key="inversum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inversum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inverto <sense id="n24735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inversura: <entryFree id="n24736" type="main" key="inversu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inversūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inverto</etym>, <sense id="n24736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus sine inversuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inversus: <entryFree id="n24737" type="main" key="inversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. inverto <sense id="n24737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invertibilitas: <entryFree id="n24738" type="main" key="inverti^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invertĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-verto</etym>, <sense id="n24738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeableness</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incommutabilitas, atque, ut ita dicam, invertibilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Mor. Eccl. 13:28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Mor. Eccl. 13, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inverto: <entryFree id="n24739" type="main" key="inverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-verto</orth>, <itype>verti, versum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn upside down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to upset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invert</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24739.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue solum Fortes invertant tauri,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn up</tr>, <tr>plough up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreas invertit ornos,</quote> <trans><tr>upturns</tr>, <tr>overthrows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinaria,</quote> <trans><tr>to upset</tr>, <tr>empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>disturbed</tr>, <tr>rough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveos navium inversos pro tuguriis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo vehementer talum inverti, ut minimum affuerim quin articulum defregerim,</quote> <trans><tr>dislocated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 134, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si polypus invertatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invertere se,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in locum anulum inverterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24739.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to dip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">albentes lanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:568" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 568</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24739.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to invert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transp?*!se; to change. alter; to pervert; to exchange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum semel dictum sit directe, invertatur ordo, et idem quasi sursum versus retroque dicatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: quae in vulgus edita <cb n="INVE" /> ejus verbis, invertere supersedeo, <hi rend="ital">to alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give in another form</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <trans><tr>to alter</tr>, <tr>misrepresent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanas,</quote> <trans><tr>to dye</tr>, <tr>color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:569" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vertumnus Deus invertendarum rerum est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of barter</tr>, <tr>trade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:1:59:section=154" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24739.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of words, <hi rend="ital">to pervert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misapply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use ironically</hi> (cf. inversio, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">invertuntur verba, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 262</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">turned upside down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inverted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24739.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomer inversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (opp. supina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:87:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 87, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">submovere Euros Pellibus inversis,</quote> <trans><tr>turned inside out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:187" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24739.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inverted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perverted</hi>: annus, <hi rend="ital">inverted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brought back to its beginning</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">completed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ended</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro curia, inversique mores!</quote> <trans><tr>perverted</tr>, <tr>corrupt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>perverted from their proper meanings</tr>, <tr>ambiguous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 131</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, verba,</quote> <trans><tr>dark</tr>, <tr>obscure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 642</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Neutr. sing.</hi> as <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inversum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">upside down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculis inversum superpositis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invesperascit: <entryFree id="n24740" type="main" key="invespe^rascit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vespĕrascit</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n24740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it becomes evening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evening is approaching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam invesperascebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
investigabilis: <entryFree id="n24741" type="main" key="investi_ga_bi^lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">investīgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>investigo</etym>, <sense id="n24741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be searched into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Tert. ap. Herm. 43; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 26, 13</bibl> (dub. al. vestigabiles).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24742" type="main" key="investi_ga_bi^lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vestīgābĭlis</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be traced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsearchable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 11, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
investigatio: <entryFree id="n24743" type="main" key="investi_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">investīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>investigo</etym>, <sense id="n24743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquiring into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum occultissimarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri (with inquisitio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 40, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
investigator: <entryFree id="n24744" type="main" key="investi_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">investīgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that searches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquires into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an investigator</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acer et diligens rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 30, 85</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24744.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contriver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
investigatrix: <entryFree id="n24745" type="main" key="investi_ga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">investīgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>investigator</etym>, <sense id="n24745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that investigates</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 442</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
investigo: <entryFree id="n24746" type="main" key="investi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vestīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (investigandum for investigandorum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 495, 26</bibl>), <sense id="n24746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to track</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trace out</hi>, as a dog; <hi rend="ital">to search after</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24746.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum tam incredibilis ad investigandum sagacitas narium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latentes conscios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">David et Viros ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24746.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to trace out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil investigo quicquam de illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dare velis, qui istaec tibi investiget indicetque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil tam difficile est, quin quaerendo investigari possiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sim, nequeo certum investigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cibyratici canes investigabant et perscrutabantur omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri investigandi cupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Lentulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentia inimici investigatum est, quod latebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Lentulus sit, investigare non possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquirere et investigare homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 8" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae per notas scripta,</quote> <trans><tr>to decipher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
investio: <entryFree id="n24747" type="main" key="investi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n24747.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: scrupeo investita saxo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 22</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 139).—</sense><sense id="n24747.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">focum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
investis: <entryFree id="n24748" type="main" key="investis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vestis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n24748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unclothed</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n24748.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nudus et investis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24748.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24748.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without a beard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beardless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 336</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri et puellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; Fest. s. v. vesticeps, p. 368 Müll.— </sense><sense id="n24748.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unmarried</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Vel. Virg. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24748.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deprived of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">investis dotalibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Ux. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inveterasco: <entryFree id="n24749" type="main" key="inve^te^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕtĕrasco</orth>, <itype>rāvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> (in the form inveteresco, Inscr. ap. Att. dell' Acad. Rom. Archeol. 2, p. 46, n. 17), <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to continue long</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24749.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quibus quisque in locis miles inveteravit, Caes. B. C. <cb n="INVI" /> 1, 44: <cit><quote lang="la">equites, qui inveteraverant Alexah. driae bellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi R. exercitum hiemare atque inveterascere in Gallia moleste ferebant,</quote> <trans><tr>to settle</tr>, <tr>establish themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum inveterascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res nostrae litterarum monumentis inveterascent et corroborabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 44</bibl>.—Of wine, <hi rend="ital">to ripen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24749.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveterate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hanc inveterascere consuetudinem nolint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (macula) penitus insedit atque inveteravit in populi Romani nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveteravit opinio perniciosa rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 41, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi significatio falsa,</quote> <trans><tr>became fixed in use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus alendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1068</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si malum inveteravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego, in nostra civitate inveterasse, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>it has grown into use</tr>, <tr>become a custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si inveterarit, actum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24749.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow weak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become obsolete</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inveterascet hoc quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa mea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 9, 21.</sense></entryFree>
inveteratio: <entryFree id="n24750" type="hapax" key="inve^te^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĕtĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>invetero</etym>, <sense id="n24750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inveterateness;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">an inveterate disease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invetero: <entryFree id="n24751" type="main" key="inve^te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕtĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give age</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duration to</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n24751.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium, cepamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 115</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquire age</hi> or <hi rend="ital">durability; to abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> (class. but rare): <cit><quote lang="la">non tam stabilis opinio permaneret, ... nec una cum saeclis aetatibusque hominum inveterari posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. inveterascere): <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea, quae inveterari volunt, nitro utuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĕtĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n24751.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Kept for a long time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur felis, inveteratum sale,</quote> <trans><tr>preserved in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16, 66, § 229</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fel vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 25, § 77</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n24751.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Inveterate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of long standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rooted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conglutinatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae atque doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:C. D. 22:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> C. D. 22, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codex,</quote> <trans><tr>hardened by age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24751.4" n="(g)" level="5"> Of diseases, sores, etc., <hi rend="ital">deep-seated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chronic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveterate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabritiae oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 12, 31, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 18, § 65</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĕtĕrāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">chronic diseases</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius contra inveterata pugnandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24751.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24751.6" n="1" level="3"> Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">inveterari,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep</tr>, <tr>last</tr>, <tr>endure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 53</bibl>.— Esp., in law, <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: inveteratus, <hi rend="ital">established by prescription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores sunt tacitus consensus populi, longa consuetudine inveteratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24751.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolish</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">notitiam veri Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
invetitus: <entryFree id="n24752" type="main" key="inve^ti^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕtĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unforbidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:441" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 441</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invicem: <entryFree id="n24753" type="main" key="invi^cem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭcem</orth>, in MSS. and edd. often separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in vĭcem</orth> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> in tmesi: <sense id="n24753.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inque vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 502</bibl>; Ov. M: 6, 631; 9, 525; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Her. 17, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:149" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 817 al.</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>in-vicis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n24753.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">by turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one after another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alternately</hi> (class., but not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. vicissim): hi rursus in vicem anno post in armis sunt: illi domi remanent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 85, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:6:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defatigatis invicem integri succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum timor atque ira invicem sententias variassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruscos, multis invicem casibus victos victoresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio invicem a suis atque hoste vexata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum invicem metuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem eum odero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebens invicem aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem alternis diebus modo aqua, modo vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem modo sedere, modo ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24753.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reciprocally</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. inter se): ibi se cognoscunt fratres invicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:Arg. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. Arg. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aricini atque Ardeates multis invicem cladibus fessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhortatio invicem totam invasit aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum sanguinem invicem hausimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: invicem <pb n="995" /> <cb n="INVI" /> amare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 20, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixerunt mira concordia, per mutuam caritatem et invicem se anteponendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem se occidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:9:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 9, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem inter se gratantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec invicem obstant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines, manibus invicem apprehensis, gradum firmant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem ardentius diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">?*!invicem se ad amorem exacuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem permutatae O atque U,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta invicem hostilia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on both sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24753.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24753.4" n="1" level="3"> Ad invicem (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">instead of</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n24753.5" n="2" level="3"> Ad invicem, <hi rend="ital">mutually</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritatem illorum ad invicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:25:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 25, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 42, 21</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in invicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab invicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 25, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Dan. 13, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro invicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 12, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invicte: <entryFree id="n24754" type="main" key="invicte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invictē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. invictus <sense id="n24754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invictrix: <entryFree id="n24755" type="gloss" key="invictrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invictrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>invictus</etym>, <sense id="n24755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconquerable</hi> (post-class.): invictricis Fortunae filius, Inscr. ap. Grut. 1065, 6.</sense></entryFree>
invictus: <entryFree id="n24756" type="main" key="invictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-victus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n24756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconquered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsubdued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not vanquished;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">unconquerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invincible;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> or <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversum</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24756.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictum se a labore praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictus a civibus hostibusque animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius prius ab illis invictum animum praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, hoc est populus Romanus, invicti ab hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a cupiditatibus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n24756.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">spartum in aquis, marique invictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 8, § 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24756.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostem et in mortem invictus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24756.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictum ad vulnera corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 167</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocodilus contra omnes ictus cute invicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 89</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adversum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversum divitias invictum animum gerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Helv. 5:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Helv. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 21</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis invictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicti viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:311" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictaque bello dextera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:878" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 878</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 6, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Cantaber hiemisque aestusque famisque Invictus, palmamque ex omni ferre labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:326" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 326</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <case>dat.</case> cunctis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 608</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambae invictae gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 191</bibl></cit>: satis vixi, invictus enim morior, Epam. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen invicti imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:38:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 38, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:346" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 346</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladis manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictae opinionis exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>reputed invincible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamas,</quote> <trans><tr>impenetrable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictior ratio,</quote> <trans><tr>irrefutable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Immort. Anim. 8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Immort. Anim. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sciunt te unum in terra vivere virtute et forma et factis invictissumum,</quote> <trans><tr>not to be surpassed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:78" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 78</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invictē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">invincibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrefutably</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">invictissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invidens: <entryFree id="n24757" type="main" key="invi^dens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdens</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. invideo <sense id="n24757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> D. 1.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24758" type="main" key="invi^dens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without vision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 51, p. 307, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invidentia: <entryFree id="n24759" type="main" key="invi^denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>invideo</etym>, <sense id="n24759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an envying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidentiam esse dicunt aegritudinem susceptam propter alterius res secundas, quae nihil noceant invidenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 21</bibl>; Scrib. Ep. § 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:9:132" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 9, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invideo: <entryFree id="n24760" type="main" key="invi^de^o1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>vīdi, vīsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24760.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24760.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., i. q. <foreign lang="greek">baskai/nein</foreign> (fascinare), <hi rend="ital">to look askance at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look maliciously</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spitefully at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast an evil eye upon</hi> (only anteclass.).—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: ut est in Menalippo: quisnam florem liberūm invidit meūm? Male Latine videtur; sed praeclare Attius; ut enim videre, sic invidere florem rectius, quam flori. Nos consuetudine prohibemur; <cit><quote lang="la">poëta jus suum tenuit et dixit audacius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis malus invidere possit,</quote> <trans><tr>produce misfortune by his evil eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 12 sq.</bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n24760.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> <cb n="INVI" /> <hi rend="ital">prejudiced</hi> against one, <hi rend="ital">to be influenced by prejudice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper dignitatis iniquus judex est, qui aut invidet aut favet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nisi invidisset is, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24760.4" n="A" level="2"> (I. q. <foreign lang="greek">fqonei=n tini/ tinos.</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To envy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grudge</hi> one any thing. </sense><sense id="n24760.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. of the person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> exciting the feeling: <cit><quote lang="la">malim mihi inimicos invidere quam inimicis me meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invident homines maxime paribus aut inferioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 209</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probus invidet nemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidet ipsa sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troasin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 137</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ne invideatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi, quibus invidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia dicitur ... etiam in eo cui invidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is cui invidetur, et invidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 11</bibl></cit>. — Of <hi rend="ital">the thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum commodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 541</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 208</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tunc quibus invideas si lividulus sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui in aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (purpura) tibi invideo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc Crasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen. of the thing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque ille Sepositi ciceris nec longae invidit avenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inviderunt laude sua mulieribus viri Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; so with <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hostes quidem sepulturā invident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Germ. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec invidebo vobis hac arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">7: qua (ratione) nulli mortalium invideo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Vit. Beat. 24:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Vit. Beat. 24, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si anticum sermonem nostro comparemus, paene jam quidquid loquimur figura est, ut hac re invidere, non ut omnes veteres et Cicero praecipue, hanc rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 11</bibl></cit>. — (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>: ob secundas res malorum hominum, Sen. de Ira, 1, 16, 5. — (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui invident, eorum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>of envious men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui invidet minor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:188" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 50, 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non equidem invideo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidit Clytie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 234</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Alicui aliquid</hi> (mostly post-class.; not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 624 sq.): fama fuit Monuni Dardanorum principis filiam pacto fratri eum invidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis caeli te regia, Caesar, invidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi senectus invidet imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 509</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber pampineas invidit collibus umbras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deprives of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 58</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.; cf. D. infra; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:86" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini misero medicinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi voluptatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3</bibl>, ext. 1. — (<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi> with <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidere alii bene esse, tibi male esse, miseriast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus est cui non invideant rem secundam optingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi> alone, <hi rend="ital">to envy the possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envy</hi> one <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oro vos id mihi dare quod multi invideant, plures concupiscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quis invideat mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: haec qui gaudent, gaudeant perpetuo suo bono; <cit><quote lang="la">qui invident, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: ego cur, acquirere pauca Si possum, invideor? (for cur mihi invidetur) <hi rend="ital">am I envied?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 56</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidetur enim commodis hominum ipsorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dixi invidiam, quae tum est, cum invidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">enviable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 13, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24760.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be loath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unwilling;</hi> with a foll. <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">invidens deduci triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 30</bibl></cit>. —With <case>abl.</case>: invidere igne rogi miseris, <hi rend="ital">to grudge</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not grant a burning and burial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 798</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his te quoque jungere, Caesar, Invideo,</quote> <trans><tr>am not willing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 550</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To emulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspire to rival</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar et se illius gloriae invidere, et illum suae invidisse dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent; to refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deny</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima, quae invideant pure apparere tibi rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidisse deos, ut Conjugium optatum viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 269</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tene invidit fortuna mihi, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereri totum natura concessit, oleum ac vinum non invidit tautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis invidit inutile ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 59</bibl></cit>: nec famam invidit Apollo, <cb n="INVI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:400" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 400</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi laude, nobis voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.— With <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hostes quidem sepulturā invident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculo proelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n24760.12" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">envious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocere invidenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive apud cupidos sive apud invidentes dicendum habuerit orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 31 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n24760.13" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">invīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n24760.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Hated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detested</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24760.15" n="(a)" level="5"> Of persons, animals, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">persona lutulenta, impura, invisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:25:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 25, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectos alios invisosque efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me invisum meo patri esse intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisos nos esse illos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
