D. 2, 66, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 246</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominae deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:13:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamem invisumque plebei Claudium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne invisi apud incolas forent, caverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:38" default="NO">5, 13, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Helena) abdiderat sese atque aris invisa sedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 574</bibl></cit> Forbig. ed. 4 ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyndaridis facies invisa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 601</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quis versutior et callidior est, hoc invisior et suspectior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi invisissimus fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.16" n="(b)" level="5"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis inmortalibus oratio nostra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna dis invisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troja jacet Danais invisa puellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitas judici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem invisam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Romanum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia invisa efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24760.17" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> sense = inimicus, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malicious</hi> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">invisum quem tu tibi fingis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 364</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tanta licentia ferri, Gentibus invisis Latium praebere cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisa belli consulibus fugiens mandat decreta senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 488</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24761" type="spur" key="invi^de^o2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>false reading for non vidit</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 391</bibl> Oud.</entryFree>
invidia: <entryFree id="n24762" type="main" key="invi^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>invidus</etym>, <sense id="n24762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">envy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grudge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jealousy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pass.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut effugiamus ambiguum nomen invidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam invidia non in eo qui invidet solum dicitur, sed etiam in eo cui invidetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 21</bibl> (whereas invidentia is only <hi rend="ital">act.;</hi> class.). </sense><sense id="n24762.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envy jealousy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-will.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of person envying: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā ducum perfidiāque militum Antigono est deditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia atque obtrectatio laudis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>. More freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia adducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus digna imitatione, non invidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia Siculi non invenere tyranni majus tormentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24762.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in phrases: sine invidia, <hi rend="ital">without ill-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungrudgingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare oscula,</quote> <trans><tr>willingly</tr>, <tr>with pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:65:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 65, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24762.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an object of envy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">illwill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae fucinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24762.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpopularity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quae me illius temporis invidia attingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in invidia esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in invidiam invidia magna esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be hated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reformidare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summam invidiam adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum . . . invidia quaesita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam placare paras, virtute relictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: non erit invidiae victoria nostra ferendae, <hi rend="ital">not sufficient to endure</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not so great as to justify so odious a result</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 628</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire in invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā onerare quemquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulare alicui invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conflare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae alicui esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam a se removere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 67</bibl></cit>: intacta invidiā media sunt: ad summa <pb n="996" /> <cb n="INVI" /> ferme tendit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 35, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronis,</quote> <trans><tr>the unpopularity of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:53" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Decemviralis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 43</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., in phrase: absit invidia verbo,</quote> <trans><tr>to be said without boasting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 7, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita remota a procellis invidiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Clu, 56, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invidiose: <entryFree id="n24763" type="main" key="invi^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. invidiosus <sense id="n24763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invidiosus: <entryFree id="n24764" type="main" key="invi^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>invidia</etym>. <sense id="n24764.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of envy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invidious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi> (i. q. invidus; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): illa peraeque Prae se formosis invidiosa dea est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 24, 10): <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 234</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24764.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Enviable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 25, 66</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nec curis erat (Pactolus) invidiosus harenis,</quote> <trans><tr>by reason of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiosior mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:603" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 603</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a good sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:73" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes procorum,</quote> <trans><tr>desired</tr>, <tr>longed for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 794</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:414" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:179" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 179</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24764.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Exciting envy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hatred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odious</hi> (i. q. invisus): <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si is invidiosus ac multis offensus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum accipere, invidiosum ad bonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiosis nominibus utebatur consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiosa oratione multitudo credula accenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatrix Venus mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 126</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">enviously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invidiously; hatefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odiously</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invidus: <entryFree id="n24765" type="main" key="invi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>invideo</etym>, <sense id="n24765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">envious</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque ambitiosus imperator neque invidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invida me spatio natura coercuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:531" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an envious person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hater</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidus alterius macrescit rebus opimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 5</bibl>.—Mostly <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istos invidos di perdant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidi, malevoli et lividi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui invidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Fortuna viris invida fortibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 524" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envious of</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis invidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Martini non invidus gloriarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus invidus etiam potentiae in crimen vocabantur—domum revocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Also of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">noxque fuit praeceps, et coeptis invida nostris,</quote> <trans><tr>hostile</tr>, <tr>inimical</tr>, <tr>unfavorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invida fata piis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:384" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatorum series,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam dente minus mordeor invido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invigilo: <entryFree id="n24766" type="main" key="invi^gi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭgĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to watch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be awake in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to be watchful over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on account of; to be intent on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay attention to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow pains upon.</hi>—With <case>dat.</case> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicis utilitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiendis domibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec capiat somnos invigiletque malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:530" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens invigilat curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:331" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:374" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque aliae victu (for victui) invigilant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatu (for venatui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:25:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 25, § 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be watchful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invigilate, viri, tacito nam tempora gressu diffugiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:151" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 151</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invigiles igitur nostris pro casibus oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 43</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibere minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:257" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 257</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭgĭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">elaborated in night vigils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligently composed</hi>: invigilata lucernis Carmina, Cinna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invilesco: <entryFree id="n24767" type="gloss" key="invi_lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vīlesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to become bad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invilito: <entryFree id="n24768" type="gloss" key="invi_li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vīlĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to account very bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi>: invilitat = <foreign lang="greek">eu)teli/zei,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
invincibilis: <entryFree id="n24769" type="main" key="invinci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vincĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24769.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Invincible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconquerable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">invincibile et insuperabile malum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24769.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Irrefutable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravia et invincibilia dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invin-cĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irrefutably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 360, 31</bibl>. <cb n="INVI" /></sense></entryFree>
invinctus: <entryFree id="n24770" type="main" key="invinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. in-vincio</etym>, <sense id="n24770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fettered</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem invinctum habere (al. in vinculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:15:6:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 15, 6, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invinius: <entryFree id="n24771" type="main" key="invi_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-vinum</etym>, <sense id="n24771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that abstains from wine</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invio: <entryFree id="n24772" type="hapax" key="invi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set foot upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">depavita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inviolabilis: <entryFree id="n24773" type="main" key="invi^o^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭŏlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">invulnerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">inviolabile telis servabant sacrumque caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:16" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inviolabilia haec ne credas forte vigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. 1, p. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia non laniabatur (Mariccus), stolidum vulgus inviolabilem credebat,</quote> <trans><tr>invulnerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24773.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inviolable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hallowed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti Dianae Leucophrynae perfugium inviolabile foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex, Cod. Th. 6, 4, 18: comitum concilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 242 al.</bibl></cit> — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭŏlābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inviolably</hi>, Cod. 2, 17, 1; Boeëth. Consol. 3 Pros. 10.</sense></entryFree>
inviolabilitas: <entryFree id="n24774" type="main" key="invi^o^la_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭŏlābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inviolability</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1249.</sense></entryFree>
inviolate: <entryFree id="n24775" type="main" key="invi^o^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭŏlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inviolatus <sense id="n24775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inviolatus: <entryFree id="n24776" type="main" key="invi^o^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24776.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inviolate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">invulnerati inviolatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus omnium civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>happy</tr>, <tr>pleasant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:875" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 875</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unploughed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid integrum atque inviolatum praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24776.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inviolable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicia potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Liv. Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus vel fas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <trans><tr>unavailable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭŏlātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inviolably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servare memoriam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 22, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servare jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inviolentus: <entryFree id="n24777" type="gloss" key="invi^o^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭŏlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not violent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Lit. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inviolo: <entryFree id="n24778" type="gloss" key="invi^o^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭŏlo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to violate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inviscero: <entryFree id="n24779" type="main" key="invisce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-viscĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put into the entrails</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n24779.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid canibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 214</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24779.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas inviscerata in cordibus nostris,</quote> <trans><tr>deeply rooted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invisco: <entryFree id="n24780" type="main" key="invisco" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-visco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>viscum</etym>, <sense id="n24780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ensnare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capture with birdlime</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 69</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n24780.1" n="2" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-visco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to besmear with birdlime</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invise: <entryFree id="n24781" type="main" key="invi_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2, invisus <sense id="n24781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invisibilis: <entryFree id="n24782" type="main" key="invi_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vīsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">invisible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseen</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">foramina, Cels. praef.: terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 29 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 35, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea in nobis sunt meliora, quae sunt invisibilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 159:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 159, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera ad illos dies invisibiles pertinentia, quibus creavit omnia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>when there was no human eye to see</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. 6:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. 6, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vīsĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">invisibly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. 6:6:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. 6, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invisibilitas: <entryFree id="n24783" type="main" key="invi_si^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invīsĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>invisibilis</etym>, <sense id="n24783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">invisibility</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invisibiliter: <entryFree id="n24784" type="main" key="invi_si^bi^li^te_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invīsĭbĭlĭtēr</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> v. invisibilis.</entryFree>
invisitatus: <entryFree id="n24785" type="main" key="invi_si^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vīsĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not seen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24785.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unseen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invisible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(potestatum) forma invisitata, vis cognita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24785.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not visited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 18</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24785.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unseen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est enim forma tam invisitata, tum nulla, quam non sibi ipse fingere animus possit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:67:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 67, 138</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">acies inaudita ante id tempus invisitataque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24785.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">uncommon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">new</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>: pro di inmortales! speciem humanam invisitatam, egregiam, indignam clade, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 225, 32</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 340 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">formas hominum invisitatas cernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis invisitata specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inviso: <entryFree id="n24786" type="main" key="invi_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vīso</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24786.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to visit</hi> a person or place: <cit><quote lang="la">ad meam majorem filiam inviso domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fratrem modo ad captivos alios inviso meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 85</bibl></cit> Brix: <cit><quote lang="la">huc intro ad me invisam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res rusticas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>: quod Lentulum <cb n="INVI" /> invisis, valde gratum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam invisas nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delum maternam invisit Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos castas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 385</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24786.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283, 22 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
invisor: <entryFree id="n24787" type="main" key="invi_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>invideo</etym>, <sense id="n24787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that envies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an envier</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 375, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 46, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invisus: <entryFree id="n24788" type="main" key="invi_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. <itype>invideo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24789" type="main" key="invi_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24789.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unseen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra maribus non invisa solum, sed etiam inaudita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>unknown</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisus atque inaccessus in id tempus saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24789.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invīsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without being seen</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">invise advenerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invitabilis: <entryFree id="n24790" type="main" key="invi_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>invito</etym>, <sense id="n24790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inviting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attractive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alluring</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invitamentum: <entryFree id="n24791" type="main" key="invi_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invitation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24791.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">filia invitamento matris suae circumlata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 322, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24791.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inducement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitamenta naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (honos), autem, non invitamentum ad tempus, sed perpetuae virtutis praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:67:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 67, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudinem ejus non libidinis habuerat invitamentum, sed gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 24</bibl></cit> (al. incitamentum): ad res necessarias, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 321, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitamenta urbis et fori,</quote> <trans><tr>attractions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invitatio: <entryFree id="n24792" type="main" key="invi_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">challenge</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aderat et hospitum invitatio liberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Epirum invitatio quam suavis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam ad dolendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit invitatio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largior vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">benigna,</quote> <trans><tr>feast</tr>, <tr>revel</tr>, <tr>banquet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invitatiuncula: <entryFree id="n24793" type="main" key="invi_ta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>invitatio</etym>, <sense id="n24793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little invitation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <trans><tr>little drinking-matches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invitator: <entryFree id="n24794" type="main" key="invi_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>invito</etym>, <sense id="n24794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who invites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inviter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternae vitae invitator, Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n24794.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the officer charged with invitations at the court</hi>, Cod. 12, 60, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris, Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:91:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 91, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invitatorius: <entryFree id="n24795" type="main" key="invi_ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>invitator</etym>, <sense id="n24795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to invitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inviting</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">operatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invitatrix: <entryFree id="n24796" type="main" key="invi_ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that invites</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:59" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invitatus: <entryFree id="n24797" type="main" key="invi_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n24797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>) [invito], <hi rend="ital">an inviting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invitation</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invite: <entryFree id="n24798" type="main" key="invi_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. invitus <sense id="n24798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invitiabilis: <entryFree id="n24799" type="main" key="invi^ti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭtĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inviolable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 626</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invito: <entryFree id="n24800" type="main" key="invi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (invitassitis for invitaveritis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 31</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perh. for invicito; root vec-; Sanscr. vak-, speak; vak'as, word; cf.: vox, convicium; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">vep-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">ei)=pon, o)/y</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n24800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to invite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertain</hi> (cf. illicio; class.). </sense><sense id="n24800.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, with simple <case>acc.</case> or <case>abl.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24800.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">ad consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n24800.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10</bibl>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cenam in hortos in posterum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24800.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: aliquem domum suam ut animum ejus in Sthenium inflammarent (cf. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign> infra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alium domos suas invitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66</bibl></cit>. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24800.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tecto ac domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitio invitabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 23</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invito eum, ut apud me diversetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ut cenem invitor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:68:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 68, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to entertain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii suos in castra, invitandi causā adducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to challenge to drink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to treat one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi> <pb n="997" /> <cb n="INVI" /> <hi rend="ital">own health</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese in cena plusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: se cibo vinoque largius, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 321, 25</bibl> (Hist. 4, 4 Dietsch). —Comic.: gladio, <hi rend="ital">to treat to the sword</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to want to kill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem clavā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24800.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24800.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To invite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">challenge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Caesare liberaliter invitor in legationem illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cosconio mortuo, in ejus locum invitor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes ad deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad audiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemiis ad quippiam agendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24800.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni id me invitet ut faciam fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitat hiemps curasque resolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitent croceis halantes floribus horti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad agrum fruendum invitat atque allectat senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">assentationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to encourage flattery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitare et allicere appetitum animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <trans><tr>to attract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam,</quote> <trans><tr>to allure to transgression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitatur vino appetentia ciborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossis invitavit mare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>conducted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">invitat somnos crepitantibus unda lapillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 604</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 28</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina invitet decedere ripa calori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24800.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanos, uti ab Rheno discederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignis verbis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 5 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
invituperabilis: <entryFree id="n24801" type="main" key="invi^tu^pe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĭtŭpĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unblamable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
invitus: <entryFree id="n24802" type="main" key="invi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. for in-vicitus; cf. Sanscr. va?*!-, to will; ava?*!as, unwilling; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(kw/n, a)-e/kwn</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n24802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">against one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwilling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reluctant</hi> (syn. coactus; class.). </sense><sense id="n24802.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">invitus me vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut viatores invitos consistere cogant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli hoc contingit sapienti, ut nihil faciat invitus, nihil dolens, nihil coactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego eum a me invitissim us dimisi,</quote> <trans><tr>very unwillingly</tr>, <tr>very much against my will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Berenicen ab urbe dimisit (Titus) invitus invitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahit invitam nova vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi>: me (te, se, etc.) invito, <hi rend="ital">against my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">your</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in spite of me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without my consent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis invitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se invito transire conarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>against his will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sequanis invitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diis hominibusque invitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invito numine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invita Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 395</bibl></cit>: invitā Minervā, <hi rend="ital">against one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s natural bent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 385</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invita Minerva, id est adversante et repugnante natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et illo et me invitissimo fiet,</quote> <trans><tr>altogether contrary both to his inclination and my own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 9</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitus feci, ut L. Flaminium e senatu eicerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">credidit, dominum non invitum fore hujus solutionis,</quote> <trans><tr>would not be ill pleased with this payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24802.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">invita in hoc loco versatur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitae properes anni spem credere terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbaque provisam rem non invita sequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dantur in invitos impia tura focos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu prospicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:575" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ope,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>furnished involuntarily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invito sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:391" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 391</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">against one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invite cepi Capuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit> (dub.).— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:89:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 89, 364</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invius: <entryFree id="n24803" type="main" key="invi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-via</etym>, <sense id="n24803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a road</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impassable</hi> (syn.: inaccessus, devius; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n24803.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per invias atque ignotas rupes iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria Teucris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupibus regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti nulla est via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 113</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil virtuti invium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheron invius renavigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 715" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 715</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">impassable places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per invia pleraque et errores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vias inviaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vias, per invia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:305" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 305</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24803.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impenetrable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>impenetrable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 514</bibl></cit>: templa, <cb n="INVO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 414</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot bellis invia tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:639" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarmaticis lorica sagittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invocatio: <entryFree id="n24804" type="main" key="invo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>invoco</etym>, <sense id="n24804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invoking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invocation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:115" default="NO">11, 3, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invocatus: <entryFree id="n24805" type="main" key="invo^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from invoco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24806" type="main" key="invo^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-voco</etym>. <sense id="n24806.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uncalled</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">imagines rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ad subsellia rei occurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24806.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uninvited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invocatus soleo esse in convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi ... invocato sit locus semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidie sic ei cena coquebatur, ut quos invocatos vidisset in foro, omnes devocaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24807" type="main" key="invo^ca_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vŏcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n24807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a non-summoning</hi>: si injussu atque invocatu meo (verba) venerint, <hi rend="ital">without my summons</hi>, Fronto ad Verum, ep. 1.</sense></entryFree>
invoco: <entryFree id="n24808" type="main" key="invo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invoke</hi> (cf. imploro), esp. as a witness or for aid. </sense><sense id="n24808.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24808.2" n="A" level="2"> With living beings as objects: alium invocat, cum alio cantat, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invoco vos, Lares viales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in pariendo Junonem Lucmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos in auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">5: deos precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deos testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:3" default="NO">5, 12, 3</bibl>.—With a foll. <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justae preces invocantium, ad ultionem accingerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24808.3" n="B" level="2"> With things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to invoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeal to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia libertati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma alicujus adversus alium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem suorum militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 3</bibl></cit> saep. — </sense><sense id="n24808.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to call by name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to name</hi>: aspice hoc sublimen candens, quem invocant omnes Jovem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl> (Trag. v. 402 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dominum, regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reginas dominasque veris quondam, tunc alienis nominibus invocantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
involator: <entryFree id="n24809" type="gloss" key="invo^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>involo</etym>, <sense id="n24809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robber</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">kle/pths,</foreign> fur, involator, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
involatus: <entryFree id="n24810" type="hapax" key="invo^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n24810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>) [id.], <hi rend="ital">a flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alitis involatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
involentia: <entryFree id="n24811" type="hapax" key="involenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-volentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for involuntas, <sense id="n24811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwillingness</hi>, Salv. de Gub. Dei, 7.</sense></entryFree>
involgo: <entryFree id="n24812" type="main" key="involgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">involgo</orth>, v. invulgo.</entryFree>
