involito: <entryFree id="n24813" type="main" key="invo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n24813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. freq.</hi> [involo], <hi rend="ital">to fly over</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n24813.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus involitat terris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> 13, 100</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24813.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">float over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeris involitant comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
involo: <entryFree id="n24814" type="main" key="invo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place; <hi rend="ital">to fly at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24814.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24814.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in villam columbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix me contineam, quin involem in capillum,</quote> <trans><tr>from flying at his hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguibus illi in oculos venefico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in possessionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take forcible possession of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 122</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24814.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: involare ad aliquem, eumque sauciare, Auct. B. Alex. 52.— </sense><sense id="n24814.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi> (syn. occupo): <cit><quote lang="la">equites ... citi ab dextera maxumo cum clamore involant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscator singulos involat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 59, 85, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">animos involat cupido eundi in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus ex hereditate, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancorae involantur de mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:9:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
involucer: <entryFree id="n24815" type="main" key="invo^lu^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vŏlŭcer</orth>, <itype>cris, cre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unable to fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfledged</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
involucre: <entryFree id="n24816" type="spur" key="invo^lu_cre"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūcre</orth>, <itype>false reading for involucri</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 17</bibl>; v. involucrum).</entryFree>
involucrum: <entryFree id="n24817" type="main" key="invo^lu_crum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūcrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>involvo</etym>, <sense id="n24817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that in which something is wrapped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wrapper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelope</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24817.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipei causa involucrum, vaginam autem gladii ... esse generata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24817.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a napkin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cloth to protect the clothing while shaving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id quidem involucri inicere voluit, vestem ut ne inquinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24817.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ingenii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulationum,</quote> <trans><tr>cover</tr>, <tr>mask</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>. <cb n="IO" /></sense></entryFree>
involumen: <entryFree id="n24818" type="gloss" key="invo^lu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>involvo</etym>, <sense id="n24818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrapper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>: involumen, <foreign lang="greek">e)nei/lhma,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
involumentum: <entryFree id="n24819" type="main" key="invo^lu_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrapper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelope</hi>, for involucrum (eccl. Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
involuntarie: <entryFree id="n24820" type="main" key="invo^lunta_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏluntārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n24820.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
involuntarius: <entryFree id="n24821" type="main" key="invo^lunta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vŏluntārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">involuntary</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">emissio urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:3:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:5:24" default="NO">2, 5, 24</bibl> sq.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏ-luntārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">involuntarily</hi>, Boëth. Arist. Top. 4, 2.</sense></entryFree>
involuntas: <entryFree id="n24822" type="main" key="invo^luntas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vŏluntas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwillingness</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex involuntate delinquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
involute: <entryFree id="n24823" type="main" key="invo^lu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. involvo, <sense id="n24823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
involutio: <entryFree id="n24824" type="main" key="invo^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>involvo</etym>, <sense id="n24824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rolling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gathering of itself together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis spirae similis sive canina involutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:11:103" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 11, 103</bibl></cit>; concr., <hi rend="ital">that which is inwrapped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infolded</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
involuto: <entryFree id="n24825" type="main" key="invo^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n24825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to inwrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infold</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
involutus: <entryFree id="n24826" type="main" key="invo^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. involvo.</entryFree>
involvo: <entryFree id="n24827" type="main" key="involvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-volvo</orth>, <itype>vi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n24827.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ossae frondosum involvere Olympum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G, 1, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas, armenta secum,</quote> <trans><tr>to sweep away with it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miser involvitur In caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 292</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24827.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to roll about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se foliis ac frondibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:970" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 970</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistras sagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput flammeolo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se farinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">involvi fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum amiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum involvit flammis nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit quoque ut involvat venti se nubibus ipse vortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec densae trepidis apium se involvere nubes cessarunt aquilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:635" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 635</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24827.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster aqua involvens navemque virosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagnante vado patulos involvere campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:143" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:622" default="NO">12, 622</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos in mediis fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vox et mutui hortatus juvabant adversante unda ... cuncta pari violentia involvebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24827.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to inwrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>: se litteris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to devote one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis nomine bellum involutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscuris vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suā virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: se laqueis insidiosae interrogationis, <hi rend="ital">to involve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entangle themselves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si qua iniquitas involveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudibus involuti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 32</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">involved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res involutas definiendo explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam a rebus occultis et ab ipsa natura involutis avocare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res omnium involutissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invŏlūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">obscurely</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">queri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Car. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
involvulus: <entryFree id="n24828" type="main" key="involvu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">involvŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">involvŏlus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>involvo</etym>, <sense id="n24828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caterpillar that wraps itself up in leaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invulgo: <entryFree id="n24829" type="main" key="invulgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vulgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring before the public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinas acroaticas libris foras editis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo die Allobroges involgarunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to give evidence</tr>, <tr>make a deposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invulgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba (opp. nova),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invulnerabilis: <entryFree id="n24830" type="main" key="invulne^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invulnĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">invulnerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animum virtus induravit, undique invulnerabilem praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invulneratus: <entryFree id="n24831" type="hapax" key="invulne^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vulnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwounded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invulnerati inviolatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
io: <entryFree id="n24832" type="main" key="i^o_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭō</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">i)w/</foreign></etym>, expressing joy, <sense id="n24832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ho! huzza! hurra!</hi> io hymen hymenaee, io hymen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles, io, magna voce, triumphe, canet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:121" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 121</bibl></cit> (118): <cit><quote lang="la">io triumphe!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">io, io, liber ad te venio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24832.1" n="II" level="1"> Expressing pain, <hi rend="ital">oh! ah!</hi> io! enicas me miserum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uror, io, remove saeva puella faces!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24832.2" n="III" level="1"> Used in a sudden or vehement call, <hi rend="ital">holla! look!</hi> <pb n="998" /> <cb n="IONI" /> <hi rend="ital">quick!</hi> io! matres, audite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">io! comites, his retia tendite silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 513</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 742</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24833" type="main" key="I_o_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īō</orth>, <itype>Iūs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īōn</orth>, <itype>Iōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iw/,</foreign> <sense id="n24833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Inachus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Argos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and changed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through fear of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into a cow; afterwards worshipped as an Egyptian deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under the name of Isis.</hi> —Form Io, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl> (3, 24), 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:588 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 588 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:351 sq" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 351 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 145" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 145</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Ius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 31</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Io, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 588</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 2, 19, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Io, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl>.—Form Ion; <case>dat.</case> Ioni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Ionem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ioannes: <entryFree id="n24834" type="main" key="Io_annes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iōannes</orth>, v. Joannes.</entryFree>
iob: <entryFree id="n24835" type="main" key="Io_b"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iōb</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iōbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Job</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 1, 1</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
iocasta: <entryFree id="n24836" type="main" key="I^o^casta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭŏcasta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭŏcastē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ioka/sth,</foreign> <sense id="n24836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Lāïus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Œdipus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom she married unknowingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and had by him Eteocles and Polynices.</hi>—Form Iocasta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:681" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 681</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 66" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 66</bibl>.—Form Iocaste, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 67" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:242" default="NO">242</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iohia: <entryFree id="n24837" type="spur" key="io^hi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">iŏhĭa</orth>, false read. for ohe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 31</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
iol: <entryFree id="n24838" type="main" key="Iol"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iol</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the former name of the city of Cæsarea in Numidia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ser-Sel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iolaus: <entryFree id="n24839" type="main" key="I^o^la_u^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭŏlāŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)io/laos,</foreign> <sense id="n24839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Iphiclus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and constant companion of his uncle Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 310</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 399</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">430</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iolcos: <entryFree id="n24840" type="main" key="I^olcos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭolcos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iolcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwlko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n24840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and harbor of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Magnesia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Pelasgic Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence Jason is said to have sailed with the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:368" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24840.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n24840.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭolcĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Iolcus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iolchian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:56" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit> (54): <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 377</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24840.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭolci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwlkoi/,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the Iolchians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 4, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iole: <entryFree id="n24841" type="main" key="I^o^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭŏlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)io/lh.</foreign> <sense id="n24841.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Eurytus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Œchalia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after killing Eurytus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">married to his son Hyllus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">278</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">394</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 35" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24841.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a female slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 35.</sense></entryFree>
iollas: <entryFree id="n24842" type="main" key="Iollas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iollas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n24842.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 640</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24842.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n24842.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek writer on medicine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:104 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 104 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ion: <entryFree id="n24843" type="main" key="i^on1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">i)/on</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n24843.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of violet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 14, § 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24843.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone of a violet color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24844" type="main" key="I_on2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/iwn,</foreign> <sense id="n24844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Xuthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who led a colony into Asia; from him is derived the name Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:454" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 454</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24844.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sculptor of the one hundred and thirteenth Olympiad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ionas: <entryFree id="n24845" type="main" key="I^o_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnas</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jōnas</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,041:1:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jon. 1, 1 al.</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwna=s,</foreign> <sense id="n24845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hebrew prophet Jonah</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 169</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 25</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24845.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Jonah</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 711</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iones: <entryFree id="n24846" type="main" key="I^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/iwnes,</foreign> <sense id="n24846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Ionians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also applied to the Athenians,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 2, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ionia: <entryFree id="n24847" type="main" key="I^o_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnĭa</orth>, v. Ionius.</entryFree>
ioniacus: <entryFree id="n24848" type="main" key="i^o_ni^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwniako/s,</foreign> <sense id="n24848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Ionian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 219</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ionice: <entryFree id="n24849" type="main" key="I^o_ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Ionicus <sense id="n24849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ionicus: <entryFree id="n24850" type="main" key="I^o_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwniko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n24850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ionic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24850.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attagen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:54" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:61:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 61, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Ionic dance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n24850.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Ionic dancer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Ionicus, aut cinaedicus, qui hoc tale facere possiet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24850.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iōnĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Ionic dance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego qui Ionica probe perdidici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 29</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24850.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp., metrical t. t., <hi rend="ital">Ionic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24850.5" n="A" level="2"> Metrum Ionicum, <hi rend="ital">an Ionic foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which consists of a pyrrhic and a spondee; when the pyrrhic precedes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is called</hi> Ionic a minore; <hi rend="ital">when the spondee precedes</hi>, Ionic a majore, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> p. 1823</bibl> P.; Mar. Vict. 2538 P.—</sense><sense id="n24850.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iōnĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Ionic foot</hi>: a majore, Mar. <cb n="IPSE" /> Vict. p. 2536 P.: <cit><quote lang="la">minor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 2539</bibl></cit> P. — (<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnĭcē</orth>, Gloss. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ionis: <entryFree id="n24851" type="main" key="I^o_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n24851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwni/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Ionian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ionides insulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 722</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24851.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">an Ionian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 362" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 362</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ionius: <entryFree id="n24852" type="main" key="I_o_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iw/nios</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)io/nnios,</foreign> <sense id="n24852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ionian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attagen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 133</bibl></cit>: Ionium mare (or <usg type="style">poet.</usg> aequor), or Ionii fluctus, Ionius sinus; or <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ionium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Ionic Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the west of Greece</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 33, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply Ionium: insulae Ionio in magno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Ionium vectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 19 (but Ionia is a false reading for Jovis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 29, § 103</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n24852.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iwni/a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a country of Asia Minor on the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Caria and Æolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO">2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:175 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 175 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ios: <entryFree id="n24853" type="main" key="I^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ios,</foreign> <sense id="n24853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island of the Sporades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Ægean Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ih=tai,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Ios, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 11, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ioseph: <entryFree id="n24854" type="main" key="Io_seph"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iōseph</orth>, v. Joseph.</entryFree>
iosephus: <entryFree id="n24855" type="main" key="Io_se_phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iōsēphus</orth>, v. Josephus.</entryFree>
iota: <entryFree id="n24856" type="greek" key="i^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭōta</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n24856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indec.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)w=ta,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the name of the Greek</hi> <foreign lang="greek">i,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">iota</hi> (in Gr. trisyl., in Lat. dissyl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut iota litteram tollas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum de titulo tollere iota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:93:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 93, 4</bibl></cit>. — Sometimes (on account of littera) <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Aus. Idyll. in Monosyllab. de Litteris, (12), 23: <cit><quote lang="la">littera iotae similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iotacismus: <entryFree id="n24857" type="greek" key="i^o_ta^cismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭōtăcismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)wtakismo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n24857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iotacism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a too frequent repetition of the letter i</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 514</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">or a doubling of its sound in pronunciation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 31, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iphianassa: <entryFree id="n24858" type="main" key="I_phi^a^nassa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭănassa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for Iphigenia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 85</bibl>.</entryFree>
iphias: <entryFree id="n24859" type="main" key="I_phi^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ifia/s,</foreign> <sense id="n24859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Iphis</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Evadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:38 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 38 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
iphiclus: <entryFree id="n24860" type="main" key="I_phi_^clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphī^clus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ifiklos,</foreign> <sense id="n24860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Argonauts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swift runner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 25</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:103" default="NO">103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:370" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 370</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iphicratensis: <entryFree id="n24861" type="main" key="I_phi_^cra^tensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphī^crătensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24861.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
iphicrates: <entryFree id="n24862" type="main" key="I_phi_^cra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphī^crătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Athenian general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iph. 1, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iphī^crătensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iphicratenses milites,</quote> <trans><tr>soldiers of Iphicrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iph. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iphigenia: <entryFree id="n24863" type="main" key="I_phi^ge^ni_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭgĕnīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (Gr. <case>acc.</case> Iphigenian, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 62</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ifige/neia,</foreign> <sense id="n24863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Iphigenīa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Agamemnon and Clytemnestra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because her father had killed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Aulis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hart belonging to Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was to be offered up by way of expiation; but the goddess put a hart in her place and conveyed her to the Tauric Chersonese</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where she became a priestess of Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and with her brother Orestes carried off Diana</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s image</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 27 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 98" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 98</bibl> and 120; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl> (4, 6), 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iphimedia: <entryFree id="n24864" type="main" key="I_phi^me^di_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭmĕdīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭmĕdē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ifime/deia,</foreign> <sense id="n24864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Alōeus</hi> (trisyl.), <hi rend="ital">who had two sons by Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Otus and Ephialtes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 582</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 28" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iphinoe: <entryFree id="n24865" type="main" key="I_phi^no^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭnŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ifino/h,</foreign> <sense id="n24865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Lemnian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:162" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 162</bibl> and 327.</sense></entryFree>
iphinous: <entryFree id="n24866" type="main" key="I_phi^no^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭnŏus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 379</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iphis: <entryFree id="n24867" type="main" key="I_phis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=ifis.</foreign> <sense id="n24867.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A youth of Cyprus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who hung himself because his love for Anaxarete was not returned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 699</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24867.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:441" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 441</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24868" type="main" key="I_phis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Cretan girl who was changed into a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 667</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iphitus: <entryFree id="n24869" type="main" key="I_phi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ifitos.</foreign> <sense id="n24869.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Eurytus and Antiope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24869.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 435</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24869.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īphĭtĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son of Iphitus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coeranos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24869.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king in Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who reinstated the Olympic games</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:363" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 363</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ipra: <entryFree id="n24870" type="main" key="Ipra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ipra</orth>, <sense id="n24870.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
iprasturgi: <entryFree id="n24871" type="main" key="Iprasturgi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iprasturgi</orth>, <sense id="n24871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Bætica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl> (Jahn reads Ipra, Isturgi).</sense></entryFree>
ipse: <entryFree id="n24872" type="main" key="ipse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ipse</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ipsus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 10</bibl> et <cb n="IPSE" /> saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 8</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 5</bibl>; Jusjur. Milit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 4 al.</bibl>), a, um (ipsud, Gloss. Philox.); <sense id="n24872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ipsīus (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> also ipsĭus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 772 al.</bibl>; and dissyl. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 13</bibl>: ipsi, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 694</bibl>); <case>dat.</case> ipsi (ipso, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 243, 24</bibl>); <hi rend="ital">pron. demonstr.</hi> [is - pse for pte; cf. sua-pte and -pote in ut-pote; root in potis; Sanscr. patis, lord, master; hence, = he, the master, himself, etc.; cf. Pott. Etym. Forsch. 2, 866 sq.; Fick, Vergl. Wörterb. p. 116. Hence, in the original form, the pronoun is was declined, while the suffix was unchanged; thus eopte = eo ipso, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=110" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eapse = ea ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 77</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> eapse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 21 al.</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> eumpse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eampse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 22 al.</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> eopse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc, 4, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eāpse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 2</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 197 sq.], = <foreign lang="greek">au)to/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (emphatic), <hi rend="ital">himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itself</hi>, used both substantively and adjectively, to denote that person (thing) of which something is eminently or exclusively predicated. </sense><sense id="n24872.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n24872.2" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pronn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24872.3" n="1" level="3"> Expressing eminence or distinction: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ille Gorgias ... in illo ipso Platonis libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ipse Marcellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 29, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicet pro me ipsa virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ipse Caesar est alienus a nobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Moeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ipse Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductores ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in ipsa arce habitarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. with names of gods, etc.: naturas quas Juppiter ipse Addidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pater ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse pater Pluton,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 327</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">audentes deus ipse juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 586</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24872.4" n="2" level="3"> For emphasis or in contrast, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adest optime ipse frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orationibus hisce ipsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea ipsa hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec carmina nobis Ipsa placent: ipsae rursus concedite silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tute ipse his rebus finem praescripsti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide ipsi hi sunt capti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego enim ipse cum eodem isto non invitus erraverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ille divinationis auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 28, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cariorem esse patriam quam nosmet ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eaque ipsa causa belli fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>the very</tr>, <tr>the true cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 1</bibl></cit>; esp. with <hi rend="ital">is</hi>, in all persons and numbers: <cit><quote lang="la">estne hic Philto? Is hercle'st ipsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tutor is fuerat ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam id ipsum absurdum, maximum malum neglegi,</quote> <trans><tr>even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 93</bibl></cit> (Madv.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus ad id ipsum congruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duum vir ad id ipsum creatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullius et eos ipsos et per eos multitudinem aliam deduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum ipsorum facta (opp. loca in quibus, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero clarorum virorum post mortem honores permanerent, si nihil eorum ipsorum animi efficerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 22, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum ipsum honorem deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51, 3</bibl></cit>; so sometimes with an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subst.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum dicere ineptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid juvat quod ante initum tribunatum veni, si ipsum, quod veni, nihil juvat?</quote> <trans><tr>the mere fact</tr>, <tr>the fact alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum, quod habuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipsum, quod sum victus, ama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 78</bibl></cit>.— Esp. in legal phrase: ipso jure, <hi rend="ital">by the letter of the law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in legal strictness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">precision</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 181</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 106</bibl> sqq. et saep.— </sense><sense id="n24872.5" n="B" level="2"> Alone, emphatically taking the place of an omitted <hi rend="ital">person.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">demonstr.</hi> <hi rend="ital">pron.: Ar.</hi> Ubi is nunc est? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Ubi ego minume atque ipsus se volt maxume, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 10</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Su.</hi> Is ipsusne's? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Aio: <hi rend="ital">Su.</hi> Ipsus es? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ipsis, ad quorum commodum pertinebat, durior inventus est Coelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeram ex ipsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus, quo ipse eos sustulisset, ad id ipsum congruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum dare immunem ipsi, qui accepisset, liberisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 45, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 34, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10</bibl>, <pb n="999" /> <cb n="IPSE" /> 6, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta et ipsis qui rem gessere expugnatio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nobis exposita, ut ab ipsis, qui eam disciplinam probant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—So freq. in Cic. before a <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de ipso, qui judicarit, judicium fieri videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:44:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 44, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi omnia, quorum negotium est, ad nos deferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 13</bibl>; v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis definitionibus utuntur, ipsique dicunt ea se modo probare, quibus natura tacita assentiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 40</bibl></cit> Madv. — </sense><sense id="n24872.6" n="C" level="2"> To make prominent one of two or more subjects of any predicate, <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (<hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">il</hi>), <hi rend="ital">for his part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he too</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as well.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24872.7" n="1" level="3"> Ipse alone: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae Metello Capuam adlatae sunt a Clodia, quae ipsa transiit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>also</tr>, <tr>in person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam ornare quam domum suam maluit: quamquam Italia ornata domus ipsa mihi videtur ornatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tris ipse excitavit recitatores,</quote> <trans><tr>he too</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tanti timoris sum ut ipse deficiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha, tametsi regem ficta locutum intellegebat, et ipse longe aliter animo agitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Rhipeus, hoc ipse Dymas omnisque juventus Laeta facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 394</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24872.8" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">conjunctions.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24872.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse etiam Fufidius in numero fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 29, 112</bibl></cit>: scribebat orationes quas alii dicerent: quamquam is etiam ipse scripsit eas, quibus pro se est usus, sed non sine Aelio; <cit><quote lang="la">his enim scriptis etiam ipse interfui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 56, 206</bibl></cit> sq. — </sense><sense id="n24872.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quoque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe quia plebs senatus consultum solvit, ipsi quoque solutum vultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul, quia collegae decretum triumphum audivit, ipse quoque triumphi flagitator Romam rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum subito Sulpicius et Albinovanus objecissent catervas, ipse quoque (Sulla) jaculatus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24872.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">et</hi> (et ipse = <foreign lang="greek">kai\ au)to/s,</foreign> ipse etiam; rare in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Zumpt, Gram. § 698): tamen et ipsi tuae familiae genere et nomine continebuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deseret eos quos una scis esse, cum habeat praesertim et ipse cohortis triginta?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornelius dictatorem Aemilium dixit, et ipse ab eo magister equitum est dictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo ego vos, socii, et ipsos cernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornelio minus copiarum datum, quia L. Manlius praetor et ipse cum praesidio in Galliam mittebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et ipse crus fregerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antoninus Commodus nihil paternum habuit, nisi quod contra Germanos feliciter et ipse pugnavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes et ipsae taedium pariunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 43</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24872.12" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">nec</hi> ( = ne ipse quidem): <cit><quote lang="la">primis repulsis Maharbal cum majore robore virorum missus nec ipse eruptionem cohortium sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil moveri viderunt, nec ipsi quicquam mutarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: crimina non quidem nec ipsa mediocria; <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ista sunt prae iis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 32, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n24872.13" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24872.14" n="A" level="2"> By way of eminence, ipse is used to indicate the chief person, host, master, teacher, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa, the mistress, etc.: ipsus tristis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum praesto video,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego eo quo me ipsa misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam norat ipsam tam bene, quam puella matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (Müll., ipsa); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagorei respondere solebant, ipse dixit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pythagoras</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec hoc oratori contingere inter adversarios quod Pythagorae inter discipulos potest ipse dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum veniat lectica Mathonis plena ipso,</quote> <trans><tr>the great man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseris ante ipsum jecur,</quote> <trans><tr>before the host</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 114</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24872.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own accord</hi> = suā sponte, ultro: <cit><quote lang="la">videar non ipse promisisse (opp. to fortuito),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de manibus delapsa arma ipsa ceciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvae clausae se ipsae aperuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 37, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae lacte domum referent distenta capellae Ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi potum venient juvenci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae ipsae Sponte sua veniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges sponte sua (tellus) primum ipsa creavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:11:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 11, 58</bibl></cit>; and <foreign lang="greek">au)tai/</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">au)to/matoi,</foreign> Theocr. Idyll. 11, 12.— </sense><sense id="n24872.16" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Himself</hi> exclusively. </sense><sense id="n24872.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">By</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipse suo tristi cum corde volutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his actis, aliud genitor secum ipse volutat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 843</bibl></cit>: tempus secum ipsa Exigit, id. <cb n="IPSE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 475</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam facile exercitu soclos conservaturus sit, qui ipso nomine ac rumore defenderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa secum ipse volvens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimando ipse secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 23, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24872.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own sake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam aequitatem et jus ipsum amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24872.19" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own nature</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ipse immani acerbāque naturā Oppianicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo imperatores, ipsi pares, ceterum opibus disparibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura serpentium, ipsa perniciosa, siti accenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 89:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 89, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24872.20" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">advv. of time.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24872.21" n="1" level="3"> Nunc ipsum, <hi rend="ital">just now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at this very time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ipsum exurit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ipsum non dubitabo rem tantam adicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tamen ipsum sine te esse non possum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24872.22" n="2" level="3"> Tum ipsum, <hi rend="ital">just then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at that very time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, quod aliquando posset accidere, ne tum ipsum accideret, timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio largitionum vitiosa est, temporibus necessaria, et tum ipsum ad facultates accommodanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tum ipsum, cum immolare velis, extorum fieri mutatio potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl> Madv.— </sense><sense id="n24872.23" n="E" level="2"> With numerals, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi> (opp. fere): <cit><quote lang="la">triginta dies erant ipsi, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>:
