<cit><quote lang="la">ipsas undecim esse legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum dixisset minus I?*! (sc. milia), populus cum risu acclamavit, ipsa esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 15, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso vigesimo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 9, § 25</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24872.24" n="F" level="1"> In reflexive uses, </sense><sense id="n24872.25" n="1" level="3"> Ipse strengthens the subject when opposed in thought to other agents; the object, when opposed to other objects; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 696; Kennedy, Gram. § 67, 3; Madv. Gram. § 487, 6. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n24872.26" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subject.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24872.27" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">non egeo medicina (i. e. ut alii me consolentur), me ipse consolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junius necem sibi ipse conscivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque potest exercitum is continere imperator, qui se ipse non continet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Artaxerxes se ipse reprehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa se virtus satis ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deponendo tutelam ipse in se unum omnium vires convertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deforme etiam est de se ipsum praedicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24872.28" n="(b)" level="5"> With special emphasis, ipse is joined to the subject to indicate its relation to itself as both subject and object, though the antithesis would suggest another case (Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum iste sic erat humilis atque demissus, ut non modo populo Romano, sed etiam sibi ipse condemnatus videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis ipse sibi inimicus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ipsi sibi bellum indixissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam se ipsi omnes natura diligant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si ex scriptis cognosci ipsi suis potuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24872.29" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero ipsam amicitiam tueri (possumus), nisi aeque amicos et nosmet ipsos diligamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal se ipsum diligit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac ut diligentissime te ipsum custodias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeianus miles fratrem suum, dein se ipsum interfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulum, quem mihi ipsi antepono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24872.30" n="2" level="3"> Ipse defines the subject of a reflexive pronoun: <cit><quote lang="la">natura movet infantem, sed tantum ut se ipse diligat (where ipse shows that se refers to infantem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: proinde consulant sibi ipsi; <cit><quote lang="la">jubeant abire se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius vim adhibendam putaverunt, quam se ipse indicasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portis murisque sibimet ipsos tecta coëgerat aedificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. 1. a. supra).—</sense><sense id="n24872.31" n="3" level="3"> Ipse stands for the reflexive pronoun, </sense><sense id="n24872.32" n="a" level="4"> Where the person or thing referred to is to be emphatically distinguished from others (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes se expetendos putent, nec id ob aliam rem, sed propter ipsos, necesse est ejus etiam partes propter se expeti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:17:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam consul senatum ipsius decretis parere prohibuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos, quidquid ipsis expediat, facturos arbitrabimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui negant se recusare, quo minus, ipsis mortuis, terrarum deflagratio consequatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid ipsius natura sit intellegit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24872.33" n="b" level="4"> In a subordinate clause, to point out either the subject of the principal clause, or the chief agent <cb n="IRA" /> or speaker; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. where se or sibi is already applied to the subject of the subordinate clause: ne ob eam rem aut suae magnopere virtuti tribueret aut ipsos despiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos ad consulem mittit, qui tantum modo ipsi liberisque vitam peterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis mortuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra nihil, quantum in ipso est, praetermittere quo minus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil umquam audivi ... nihil de re publica gravius, nihil de ipso modestius, i. e. de ipso dicente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: id quod ipsum adjuvat (i. e. dicentem; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. id quod adversario prodest),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:21:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 21, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24872.34" n="c" level="4"> In gen., for an emphatic se or sibi (mostly post-Aug.; v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 40</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nam ipsis certum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:46:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 46, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravitas consulum discordiaque inter ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inexperta remedia haud injuria ipsis esse suspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecis nuntiare jubet, ipsum quidem gratias agere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit, ab illo deo ipsos genus ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus nec acceperunt injuriam nec accepisse ipsos existimant, Sen. de Ira, 2, 5, 1: intemperantiam in morbo suam experti parere ipsis vetant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:ib. 3:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciunt ipsos omnia habere communia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Ep. 6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:22:10" default="NO">22, 10</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verum est etiam iis, qui aliquando futuri sint, esse propter ipsos consulendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24872.35" n="4" level="3"> Ipse stands in free constr. with <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> as with <hi rend="ital">finite verb</hi> (cf. also quisque; <cit><quote lang="la">only freq. in Liv. and post-Aug. writers): cum dies venit, causa ipse pro se dicta, quindecim milibus aeris damnatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani imperatores, junctis et ipsi exercitibus ... ad sedem hostium pervenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Popilius, dimissis et ipse Atticis navibus ... pergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina et Autronius parabant consules interficere, ipsi fascibus conreptis Pisonem cum exercitu mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amisso et ipse Pacoro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 37</bibl></cit>; cf. also the emphatic use of ipse (like quisque) with <case>abl.</case> of <hi rend="ital">gerund</hi> (freq. in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">adsentando indignandoque et ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogendo ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agendo ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimando ipse secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 23, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.?*! Ipse is very rarely strengthened by the suffix -met: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsemet abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsimet nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsemet profugiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 21</bibl></cit>; also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aq. 74" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aq. 74</bibl> ex conj.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.: Com.</hi> Ergo ipsusne es? <hi rend="ital">Charm.</hi> Ipsissumus, <hi rend="ital">his own very self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 146</bibl>; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">au)to/tatos,</foreign> Aristoph. Plut. 83; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ipsimus and ipsima, for dominus and domina (cf II. A. supra),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75, 11</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsimi nostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 63, 3</bibl></cit> Büch. ex conj.</sense></entryFree>
ipsiplices: <entryFree id="n24873" type="gloss" key="ipsi^pli^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ipsĭplĭces</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">au)to/ptukta fu/lla,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
ipsippe: <entryFree id="n24874" type="gloss" key="ipsippe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ipsippe</orth>, <itype>ipsi neque alii</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=105" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 105</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
ipsullices: <entryFree id="n24875" type="gloss" key="ipsullices"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ipsullices</orth>, <itype>bracteae in virilem muliebremque speciem expressae</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=105" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 105</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
ir: <entryFree id="n24876" type="main" key="ir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ir</orth>, v. hir.</entryFree>
ira: <entryFree id="n24877" type="main" key="i_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n24877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> iraï <cit><quote lang="la">for irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 303</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred to Sanscr. īr, tremere, commoveri; cf.: ir-ya, vigorous; iras-yati, to be angry; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/ris, e)re/qw</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n24877.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira est libido poeniendi ejus, qui videatur laesisse injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira, quae quamdiu perturbationem habet, dubitationem non habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 36, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira furor brevis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira est cupiditas ulciscendae injuriae, Sen. de Ira, 1, 2, 4: facit ira nocentem Hunc sexum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:647" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid per iram,</quote> <trans><tr>in anger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus irae suae quam utilitati communi paruisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to his anger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā et dolore incensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pelop. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā commotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuere iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 12:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 2:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evomere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:54" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sufficit irae occidisse aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgere irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram exstinguere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderari irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone irae frena modumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantulacumque est occasio, sufficit irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:183" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum defervescat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 78</bibl></cit>: deflagrat, Liv. <pb n="1000" /> <cb n="IRAS" /> 40, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">decedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae sunt inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira inter eas intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Romanos, propter obsides nuper interfectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 378</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quorum mente pares sunt Et similes ira atque fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 131</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres in Populum Romanum irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excitare iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribiles exercere iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollire iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">induere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:38" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid ex foedere rupto irarum in nos caelestium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras plumbeas gerere,</quote> <trans><tr>heavy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde irae et lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 168</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">obj.-gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob iram fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissae praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diremptae pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:51" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ereptae virginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 413</bibl></cit>.—So, <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae imperatorum,</quote> <trans><tr>against the commanders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladum,</quote> <trans><tr>because of</tr>, <tr>indignation at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:271" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 271</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24877.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24877.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cause of anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provocation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut age, dic aliquam, quae te mutaverit, iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24877.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An object of anger</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hatred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justae quibus est Mezentius irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 714</bibl></cit> Jan. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal est irae tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:604" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 604</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24877.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A passion</hi> inspired by anger (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">subit ira cadentem Ulcisci patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 575</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24877.6" n="D" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuosity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 4:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 4, 61, 3</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ira belli desenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:149" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dant mucronibus iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:344" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:610" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 610</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24877.7" n="III" level="1"> Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">comunt Furor Iraque cristas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:424" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 424</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iraeque Insidiaeque, dei (Mavortis) comitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atraeque genis pallentibus Irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:205" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4</bibl>. 437.</sense></entryFree>
iracunde: <entryFree id="n24878" type="main" key="i_ra_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrācundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. iracundus <sense id="n24878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
iracundia: <entryFree id="n24879" type="main" key="i_ra_cundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrācundĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>iracundus</etym>, <sense id="n24879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proneness to anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastiness of temper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irascibility; violence of anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo in aliis anxietas, unde anxii, in aliis iracundia dicitur, quae ab ira differt: estque aliud iracundum esse, aliud iratum, ut differt anxietas ab angore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo distet (ira) ab iracundia apparet, Sen. de Ira, 1, 4, 1: prae iracundiā vix sum apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">omittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam rei publicae dimittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to sacrifice to the good of the state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse summā iracundiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiā ardere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiā efferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiā exardescere ac stomacho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflammari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam irritare, aut mitigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl></cit>: opportunus ad iracundiam, Sen. de Ira, 2, 19, 1.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundias domitas habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistere implacabilibus iracundiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iracunditer: <entryFree id="n24880" type="main" key="i_ra_cundi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrācundĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. iracundus <sense id="n24880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
iracundus: <entryFree id="n24881" type="main" key="i_ra_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrācundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ira</etym>, <sense id="n24881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irascible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choleric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ireful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily provoked</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">iratus potest non esse iracundus: iracundus non potest aliquando iratus non esse, Sen. de Ira, 1, 4, 1 (al. om. non before potest): ut non tantum iratus sit sapiens, sed iracundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt morosi et anxii et iracundi senes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundum esse in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum posset leniri, Sen. de Ira, 1, 1, 1: tale non est ira, sed quasi ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 296</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundior est paulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: iracundissimus, Sen. de Ira, 2, 6, 4; 2, 15, 1.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque patimur Iracunda Jovem ponere fulmina,</quote> <trans><tr>easily provoked</tr>, <tr>held in readiness to fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n24881.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">īrācundē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">angrily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 143</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundius docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24881.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">īrācundĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">angrily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionately</hi>: rem agere, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 11, 45</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
irascentia: <entryFree id="n24882" type="main" key="i_rascenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrascentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irascor</etym>, <sense id="n24882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choler</hi> (post-class. for iracundia), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 37</bibl>. <cb n="IRIN" /></sense></entryFree>
irascibilis: <entryFree id="n24883" type="main" key="i_rasci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrascĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>irascor</etym>, <sense id="n24883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">choleric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irascible</hi> (post-class.): irascibilem effici, Firm. Math. 5, 9.</sense></entryFree>
irascitivus: <entryFree id="n24884" type="main" key="i_rasci^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrascĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choleric</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 1, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irascor: <entryFree id="n24885" type="main" key="i_rascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrascor</orth>, <itype>īrātus</itype> (<sense id="n24885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">īra-sco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, Pompon. and Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 8 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irascier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>ira</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in a rage</hi> (syn.: succenseo, indignor); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> with <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">acc. of pronouns</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24885.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di inmortales hominibus irasci et succensere consuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego non tibi irascor, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miror, cur tu huic irascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitati candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his irascebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 11, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi irascerer: tibi ego possem irasci?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irasci amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: erroribus, Sen. de Ira, 2, 10, 1.—</sense><sense id="n24885.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli irascier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nihilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam sapiens irascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam irasci desinet sapiens, si semel coeperit, Sen. de Ira, 2, 9, 1: nec cuiquam irasci propiusque accedere virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irasci, quod ausi hoc essent superi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nesciat irasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:360" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 360</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24885.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an et in hunc fratrem irascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:32:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 32, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratus est Dominus in populum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:105:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 105, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus irasci in cornua discit,</quote> <trans><tr>to gather his rage into his horns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 232</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24885.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: idne irascimini, si quis, etc., Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nostram vicem irascaris,</quote> <trans><tr>with us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 6</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Rarely with <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: viri pro suorum injuriis, Sen. de Ira, 1, 12, 4. — </sense><sense id="n24885.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pelago ventus irascitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratus est furor meus in te,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irascetur furor eorum in nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:123:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 123, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">īrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">angered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numquid iratus es mihi propter has res?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum adversario judicem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ìratus de judicio, et de vilico!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis irata est, non hoc irata negabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:568 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 568 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sint tibi (convivi) irati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non existimo Marcellum ideo fortem fuisse, quia fuerit iratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quasi fortuitus nec ventorum rabie, sed iratus cadat in terras ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:226" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 226</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archytas cum vilico factus esset iratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 78</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar illis fuerat iratissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24885.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <trans><tr>ravening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis,</quote> <trans><tr>violent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 62: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">sistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 93</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">īrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">angrily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 14</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irate: <entryFree id="n24886" type="main" key="i_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. irascor, <sense id="n24886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
iratus: <entryFree id="n24887" type="main" key="i_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. irascor <sense id="n24887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ircei: <entryFree id="n24888" type="gloss" key="ircei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ircei</orth>, <itype>genus farciminis in sacrificiis</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
ircus: <entryFree id="n24889" type="main" key="ircus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ircus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. hircus.</entryFree>
irenaceus: <entryFree id="n24890" type="main" key="i_re_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrēnācĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hedgehog</hi> (al. erinaceus, herinaceus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 63, 83, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8, 21, § 65</bibl>; 8, 35, 53, § 125.</sense></entryFree>
irenarcha: <entryFree id="n24891" type="greek" key="i_re_narcha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrēnarcha</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">īrēnarches</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">eirhna/rxhs,</foreign> <sense id="n24891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a justice of the peace</hi> in the provinces (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:6" default="NO">48, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iresiae: <entryFree id="n24892" type="main" key="Iresiae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iresiae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iri: <entryFree id="n24893" type="main" key="i_ri_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrī</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">īrĭer</orth>, v. 1. eo.</entryFree>
iriates: <entryFree id="n24894" type="main" key="Iri^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Irĭātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Julia Iria, <hi rend="ital">in Liguria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Dertona (now <hi rend="ital">Voghierro</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 10</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 49</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
iricolor: <entryFree id="n24895" type="main" key="i_ri^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>iris-color</etym>, <sense id="n24895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rainbowcolored</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pluma columbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irine: <entryFree id="n24896" type="main" key="Iri^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Irĭnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Argolic Gulf</hi>, the modern Ypsili, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 56</bibl>. <cb n="IRRA" /></sense></entryFree>
irinus: <entryFree id="n24897" type="greek" key="i_ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/rinos,</foreign> <sense id="n24897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the plant iris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">iris-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 14, 43, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 8</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">īrĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">ointment made from the iris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">iris-ointment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irio: <entryFree id="n24898" type="main" key="i_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a siliquose plant</hi>, called by the Greeks sisymbrium, <hi rend="ital">winter-cresses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:158 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 75, § 158 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
iris: <entryFree id="n24899" type="main" key="I_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īris</orth>, <itype>is or idis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Irim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 694</bibl>: Irin, Ov. and App.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=iris,</foreign> <sense id="n24899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of the rainbow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Thaumas and Electra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sister of the Harpies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the swift-footed messenger of the gods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Irim de caelo misit Saturnia Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 606</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 700</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 803</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 631</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 830 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi> Irī, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 585</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24899.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24899.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The rainbow</hi>: Irin vulgo arcus esse aiunt, quando imago solis vel imago lunae umidam et cavam nubem densamque ad instar speculi colorat, etc., App. de Mundo, 16, p. 64, 10; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 1</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">iris erat in circuitu sedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 26</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24899.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sweet-smelling plant</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the sword-lily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 19, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:2" default="NO">12, 53, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n24899.4" n="C" level="2"> (Iris stone.) <hi rend="ital">A precious stone</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">a very pure six-sided prismatic crystal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 52, § 136</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24899.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A river that flows into the Euxine Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:600" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 600</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iritis: <entryFree id="n24900" type="main" key="I_ritis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īritis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)riti/s,</foreign> = Iris, II. B., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 52, § 138</bibl>.</entryFree>
irnea: <entryFree id="n24901" type="main" key="irne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irnĕa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">irnĕla</orth>, v. hirn-.</entryFree>
ironia: <entryFree id="n24902" type="greek" key="i_ro_ni_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrōnīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)rwnei/a,</foreign> <sense id="n24902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:54 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 54 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ulla ironia loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: ea dissimulatio, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">eirwnei/an</foreign> vocant, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ironia? Nonne etiam, quae severissime fit, joci prope genus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 68</bibl></cit> (al. quae sit verissima); 8, 6, 54; 9, 1, 3 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
ironice: <entryFree id="n24903" type="main" key="i_ro_ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īrōnĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)rwnikw=s,</foreign> <sense id="n24903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ironically</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irpex: <entryFree id="n24904" type="main" key="irpex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irpex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hirpex</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/rpac,</foreign> <sense id="n24904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large rake with iron teeth</hi>, used for the same purpose as our <hi rend="ital">harrow</hi> (still called <hi rend="ital">erpice</hi> by the Italians), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irpini: <entryFree id="n24905" type="main" key="Irpi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Irpīni</orth>, v. Hirpini.</entryFree>
irpus: <entryFree id="n24906" type="main" key="irpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sabine</etym>, <sense id="n24906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wolf</hi>: (lupus) quem irpum dicunt Samnites, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 785</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irquitallus: <entryFree id="n24907" type="main" key="irqui^tallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irquĭtallus</orth>, v. hirquitallus.</entryFree>
irradio: <entryFree id="n24908" type="main" key="irra^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrădĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. inradio</etym>, <sense id="n24908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to illumine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irradiate; to beam forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast forth rays</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n24908.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24908.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc undique gemmae irradiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 64</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24908.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes Romanis floribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24908.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeperat felix Irradiare dies,</quote> <trans><tr>to dawn</tr>, <tr>break</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Apol. Dav. 8, § 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrado: <entryFree id="n24909" type="main" key="irra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrādo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. in-rado</etym>. <sense id="n24909.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To scrape into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem silphium irradito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. § 8.—</sense><sense id="n24909.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To scrape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make smooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput irrasum,</quote> <trans><tr>shaved</tr>, <tr>bald</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrasus: <entryFree id="n24910" type="main" key="irra_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrāsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from irrado.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24911" type="main" key="irra_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrāsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrado</etym>, <sense id="n24911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshaved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not smooth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aptabat dextris irrasae robora clavae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:584" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 584</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrationabilis: <entryFree id="n24912" type="main" key="irra^ti^o_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrătĭōnābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrational</hi> (post-class.; not in Quint., v. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 16</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 12, 15</bibl></cit>.— Of musical intervals, = logica, <hi rend="ital">proportional</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmonic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrationabilia (sunt) quibus non subest ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 949</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrătĭōnābĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">unreasoning creatures</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrătĭōnābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irrationally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:199" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrationabilitas: <entryFree id="n24913" type="hapax" key="irra^ti^o_na_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrătĭōnābĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irrationabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irrationality</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 92, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrationabiliter: <entryFree id="n24914" type="main" key="irra^ti^o_na_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrătĭōnābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. irrationabilis <sense id="n24914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
irrationalis: <entryFree id="n24915" type="main" key="irra^ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrătĭōnālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-rationalis</etym>, <sense id="n24915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrational</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:24" default="NO">24</bibl>; Sen. Ep. <pb n="1001" /> <cb n="IRRE" /> 113, 17; 118, 14; <cit><quote lang="la">124, 23: usus,</quote> <trans><tr>mechanical exercises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrătĭōnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">things</hi> or <hi rend="ital">creatures without reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de irrationalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irră-tĭōnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irrationally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
irraucesco: <entryFree id="n24916" type="hapax" key="irraucesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irraucesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>rausi, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n24916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. in-raucus], <hi rend="ital">to become hoarse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paulum irrauserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 259</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irraucus: <entryFree id="n24917" type="main" key="irraucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irraucus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoarse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrecitabiliter: <entryFree id="n24918" type="main" key="irre^ci^ta_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕcĭtābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-recito</etym>, <sense id="n24918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unutterably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unspeakably</hi>, Venant. Carm. 3, 9, 49.</sense></entryFree>
irrecogitatio: <entryFree id="n24919" type="main" key="irre^co_gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕcōgĭtātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. inrecogitatio</etym>, <sense id="n24919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsiderateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtlessness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhortat. ad Cast. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrecordabilis: <entryFree id="n24920" type="main" key="irre^corda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕcordābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrecordabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be remembered</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">oblitteratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrecuperabilis: <entryFree id="n24921" type="main" key="irre^cu^pe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕcŭpĕrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrecupero</etym>, <sense id="n24921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irrecoverable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreparable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unalterable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrecusabilis: <entryFree id="n24922" type="main" key="irre^cu_sa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕcūsābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrecusabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be refused</hi> (post class.): <cit><quote lang="la">occasio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60, 14</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕcūsābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without possibility of refusal</hi>, Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1218.</sense></entryFree>
irredivivus: <entryFree id="n24923" type="hapax" key="irre^di^vi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕdĭvīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inredivivus</etym>, <sense id="n24923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreparable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be restored</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irredux: <entryFree id="n24924" type="hapax" key="irre^dux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕdux</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ŭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-redux</etym>, <sense id="n24924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not bring back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 408</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irreformabilis: <entryFree id="n24925" type="main" key="irre^forma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕformābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inreformo</etym>, <sense id="n24925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unalterable</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vell. 1</bibl>; adv. Valent. 29.</sense></entryFree>
irrefragabilis: <entryFree id="n24926" type="main" key="irre^fra_ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕfrāgābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrefragor</etym>, <sense id="n24926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irrefragable</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> ug. ad Fr. Erem. Serm. 35</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕfrāgābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inviolably</hi>: Catholici dogmatis fundamenta observare, Ven. Fort. Vit. Hilar. 1 praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
irrefutabilis: <entryFree id="n24927" type="main" key="irre^fu_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕfūtābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-refuto</etym>, <sense id="n24927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irrefutable</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 139</bibl>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕfūtābĭlĭter</orth>, Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 1, 48.</sense></entryFree>
irrefutatus: <entryFree id="n24928" type="main" key="irre^fu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕfūtātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrefutatus</etym>, <sense id="n24928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unrefuted</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
irregibilis: <entryFree id="n24929" type="main" key="irre^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕgĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-regibilis</etym>, <sense id="n24929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ungovernable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmanageable</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 3</bibl>: laxitas corporis (i. e. <hi rend="ital">very large</hi>, = immoderata), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:107" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irregressibilis: <entryFree id="n24930" type="main" key="irregressi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irregressĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inregressio</etym>, <sense id="n24930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which there is no return</hi> (eccl. Lat.): transgressio, Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 22.</sense></entryFree>
irreligatus: <entryFree id="n24931" type="main" key="irre^li^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕlĭgātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inreligatus</etym>, <sense id="n24931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">croceas irreligata comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 530</bibl></cit>: ratis, <hi rend="ital">not moored</hi>, Pedo <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irreligio: <entryFree id="n24932" type="main" key="irre^li^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕlĭgĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-religio</etym>, <sense id="n24932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreligion</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trismeg. p. 91</bibl> (but not in <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 21</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
irreligiose: <entryFree id="n24933" type="main" key="irre^li^gi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕlĭgĭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. irreligiosus <sense id="n24933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
irreligiositas: <entryFree id="n24934" type="main" key="irre^li^gi^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕlĭgĭōsĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irreligiosus</etym>, <sense id="n24934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreligion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impiety</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 24</bibl>; Salv. Gub. Dei, 6, 15: inexpiabilis, Hilar. in Matt. 5, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
irreligiosus: <entryFree id="n24935" type="main" key="irre^li^gi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕlĭgĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inreligiosus</etym>, <sense id="n24935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreligious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">irreligiosum ratus, sacerdotes pedibus ire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (templi) dedicationem differre longius irreligiosum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Caesares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest irreligiosius quidpiam existimari?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 185</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum irreligiosissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕlĭgĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua irreligiose dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irremeabilis: <entryFree id="n24936" type="main" key="irre^me^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕmĕābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-remeabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which one cannot return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irremeable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 548" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Styx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:41" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irremediabilis: <entryFree id="n24937" type="main" key="irre^me^di^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕmĕdĭābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inremediabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incurable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irremediable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond cure</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24937.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vino cicuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 152</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24937.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> <cb n="IRRE" /> </sense><sense id="n24937.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa malorum, Salv. Gub. Dei, 4, p. 121: lacrimae,</quote> <trans><tr>not to be checked</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 10, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24937.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Implacable</hi>: factio, Maecenas ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irremisse: <entryFree id="n24938" type="main" key="irre^misse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕmissē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-remisse</etym>, <sense id="n24938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpardonably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexorably</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irremissibilis: <entryFree id="n24939" type="main" key="irre^missi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕmissĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inremissibilis</etym>, <sense id="n24939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpardonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irremissible</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">peccata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blasphemia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 42, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irremotus: <entryFree id="n24940" type="main" key="irre^mo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕmōtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inremotus</etym>, <sense id="n24940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unremoved</hi> (post-class.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 5, 407.</sense></entryFree>
irremunerabilis: <entryFree id="n24941" type="main" key="irre^mu_ne^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕmūnĕrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-remuneror</etym>, <sense id="n24941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be compensated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be remunerated</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 269.</sense></entryFree>
irremuneratus: <entryFree id="n24942" type="main" key="irre^mu_ne^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕmūnĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-remuneratus</etym>, <sense id="n24942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unrewarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unremunerated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">suboles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irreparabilis: <entryFree id="n24943" type="main" key="irre^pa^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕpărābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-reparabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreparable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrecoverable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irretrievable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 467</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
