irrepercussus: <entryFree id="n24944" type="main" key="irre^percussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕpercussus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-repercutio</etym>, <sense id="n24944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not retorted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not refuted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrepertus: <entryFree id="n24945" type="main" key="irre^pertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕpertus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inreperio</etym>, <sense id="n24945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undiscovered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 648" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 648</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrepletus: <entryFree id="n24946" type="main" key="irre^ple_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕplētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrepleo</etym>, <sense id="n24946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not filled</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 17, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrepo: <entryFree id="n24947" type="main" key="irre_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrēpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>repsi, reptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. in-repo</etym>, <sense id="n24947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n24947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">draconem repente irrepsisse ad eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(salamandra) si arbori irrepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 23, § 74</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrepsi tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 87</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>, p. 206: <cit><quote lang="la">caveam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 149: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 219: <cit><quote lang="la">Mogontiacum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24947.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">haec lues ... inrepsit in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inrepsisse medicinam,</quote> <trans><tr>to be gradually introduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrepentes radiculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrepentibus aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit> Schneid. — </sense><sense id="n24947.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get into in an imperceptible manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insinuate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: laetitia in sinum, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 500, 26</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 141 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia irrepit in sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mentes hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabulas municipiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in testamenta locupletium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 19, 75</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24947.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inrepere paulatim militares animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24947.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor animo irrepet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 26</bibl></cit>: irrepsit subito canities seni, Prud. prooem. 23.—</sense><sense id="n24947.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentoque irrepunt agmine poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus irrepere per luxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irreposcibilis: <entryFree id="n24948" type="main" key="irre^posci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕposcĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inreposcibilis</etym>, <sense id="n24948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be demanded back</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irreprehensibilis: <entryFree id="n24949" type="main" key="irre^pre^hensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕprĕhensĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-reprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n24949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unblamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreprehensible</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 53</bibl> (with inculpabiles): <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕprĕhensĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unblamably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irreprehensus: <entryFree id="n24950" type="main" key="irre^pre^hensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕprĕhensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without blame</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">probitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <trans><tr>true</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 340</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irreptio: <entryFree id="n24951" type="main" key="irrepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irreptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irrepo</etym>, <sense id="n24951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a creeping in</hi> (late Lat.), Aug Ep. 107.</sense></entryFree>
irrepto: <entryFree id="n24952" type="main" key="irrepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrepto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to creep into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crawl upon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n24952.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus Lycurgo,</quote> <trans><tr>cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:386" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeris avi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 3, 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24952.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mycenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:731" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 731</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irreptor: <entryFree id="n24953" type="main" key="irreptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irreptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who creeps in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an encroacher</hi>: agrorum, Cod. Th. 2, 26, 2.</sense></entryFree>
irrequiebilis: <entryFree id="n24954" type="main" key="irre^qui^e_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕquĭēbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrequiesco</etym>, <sense id="n24954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be stilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis,</quote> <trans><tr>that cannot be allayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 105" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrequies: <entryFree id="n24955" type="main" key="irre^qui^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕquĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ētis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-requies</etym>,<cb n="IRRE" />  <sense id="n24955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unresting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">always in action</hi> or <hi rend="ital">motion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrequietus: <entryFree id="n24956" type="main" key="irre^qui^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕquĭētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrequietus</etym>, <sense id="n24956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restless</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Enipeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:443" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Charybdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 10:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuitus mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus (mundi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24956.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">disquieting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing unrest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrequisitus: <entryFree id="n24957" type="main" key="irre^qui_si_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕquīsītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-requiro</etym>, <sense id="n24957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsought for</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irresectus: <entryFree id="n24958" type="hapax" key="irre^sectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕsectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-reseco</etym>, <sense id="n24958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:47" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irresolubilis: <entryFree id="n24959" type="main" key="irre^so^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕsŏlūbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-resolubilis</etym>, <sense id="n24959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indissoluble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 19, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irresolutus: <entryFree id="n24960" type="main" key="irre^so^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕsŏlūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inresolvo</etym>, <sense id="n24960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unloosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not loosened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: nexus, Boëth. Cons. 3; Metr. 2, 4.</sense></entryFree>
irrespirabilis: <entryFree id="n24961" type="main" key="irrespi_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrespīrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrespiro</etym>, <sense id="n24961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in which one cannot breathe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hypobrychium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrestinctus: <entryFree id="n24962" type="main" key="irrestinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrestinctus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrestinguo</etym>, <sense id="n24962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unextinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:29" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the feelings: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 915</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irretio: <entryFree id="n24963" type="main" key="irre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrētĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. in-rete</etym>, <sense id="n24963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to catch in a net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ensnare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi> (syn.: illaqueo, implico; class.). </sense><sense id="n24963.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ad illum, qui te captare vult, utrum tacentem irretiat te, an loquentem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum pluribus radicibus impeditum, et quasi irretitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24963.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to embarrass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">festinandi studio aliis irretientibus alios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24963.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensnare</hi>: si laqueis, manicis, pedicis mens irretita est, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 350, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se erratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem corruptelarum illecebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines judiciis iniquissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantiunculis irretitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici disputationum suarum atque interrogationum laqueis te irretitum tenerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquacitas interrogationibus irretita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irretitus: <entryFree id="n24964" type="main" key="irre_ti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrētītus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from irretio.</entryFree>
irretortus: <entryFree id="n24965" type="main" key="irre^tortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕtortus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inretorqueo</etym>, <sense id="n24965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not turned back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculo irretorto Spectat acervos,</quote> <trans><tr>without looking back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irretractabilis: <entryFree id="n24966" type="main" key="irre^tracta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕtractābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inretracto</etym>, <sense id="n24966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irrevocable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:33" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 33</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕtractābĭlĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irrevocably</hi>: custodire decreta, Facund. Def. 12, 3.</sense></entryFree>
irreverens: <entryFree id="n24967" type="main" key="irre^ve^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕvĕrens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrevereor</etym>, <sense id="n24967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not show due respect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disrespectful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreverent</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n24967.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24967.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24967.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prophetam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24967.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eris tam irreverens ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:8:28" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 8, 28</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup. absol.</hi>: quam sint nequissimi et irreverentissimi, Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 2.—With <hi rend="ital">erga</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irreverentissimi erga deos vestros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 10</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕvĕrenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">disrespectfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreverently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irreverenter et temere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irreverentia: <entryFree id="n24968" type="main" key="irre^ve^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕvĕrentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irreverens</etym>, <sense id="n24968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of due respect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disrespect</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">coalitam libertate irreverentiam prorupisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus, fas nefasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>inattention to</tr>, <tr>neglect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irreverentia ipsius obturatio aurium,</quote> <trans><tr>profanity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 27, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrevocabilis: <entryFree id="n24969" type="main" key="irre^vo^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕvŏcābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inrevocabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be recalled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrevocable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24969.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <trans><tr>uncontrollable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in casum irrevocabilem se dare,</quote> <trans><tr>unalterably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel emissum volat irrevocabile verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1</bibl></cit>. 18, 71: <cit><quote lang="la">constantia,</quote> <trans><tr>unchangeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24969.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ancorae pondere irrevocabili<pb n="1002" /> <cb n="IRRI" />  jactae, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of their great weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cannot be drawn back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 35, 65, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domitiani natura praeceps in iram et, quo obscurior, eo irrevocabilior,</quote> <trans><tr>the more implacable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <trans><tr>not to be sheathed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donatio,</quote> <trans><tr>irreversible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 34</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕvŏcābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irrevocably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchangeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incessantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:35:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">progredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 120:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 120, 24</bibl></cit>; id. Civ. Dei, 22, 20, 1.</sense></entryFree>
irrevocandus: <entryFree id="n24970" type="main" key="irre^vo^candus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕvŏcandus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-revoco</etym>, <sense id="n24970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be recalled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrevocable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrevocatus: <entryFree id="n24971" type="main" key="irre^vo^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĕvŏcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not called back.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n24971.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not asked to repeat a thing; without an encore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum loca jam recitata revolvimus irrevocati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24971.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be called</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kept back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab acri caede lupus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 401</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. revocatus).</sense></entryFree>
irridenter: <entryFree id="n24972" type="main" key="irri_denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīdenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. irrideo <sense id="n24972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
irrideo: <entryFree id="n24973" type="main" key="irri_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīdĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>rīsi, rīsu , 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. in-rideo] (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, M. Brutus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl> P.). </sense><sense id="n24973.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to laugh at</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to joke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrides in re tanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam aperte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar mihi irridere visus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lemnii irridentes responderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multum irridentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui irrident, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ille irridens ... inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irridens respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24973.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridicule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laugh to scorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis tuis rebus meas res irrides malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venis ultro irrisum dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per jocum deos irridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam atque contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos ab illo irridemini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel irrisus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpessus es non irridendam moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae irrideri ab imperitis solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrisam sine honore ratem Sergestus agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox praeconis irrisa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam irridendi sui facultatem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 39</bibl></cit>.— Aliquem irrisum habere, <hi rend="ital">to make a laughing-stock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me impune irrisum esse habitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 83</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrī-denter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">jeeringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoffingly</hi> (anteand post-class.): petit, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 181</bibl> P. (Com. Fragm. v. 93 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">admonere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
irridicule: <entryFree id="n24974" type="hapax" key="irri_di^cu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīdĭcŭlē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-ridicule</etym>, <sense id="n24974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwittily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non irridicule quidam ex militibus dixit,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>wittily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irridiculum: <entryFree id="n24975" type="main" key="irri_di^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīdĭcŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>irrideo</etym>, <sense id="n24975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laughing-stock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irridiculo habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a laughing-stock of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irridiculum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a laughing-stock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrigatio: <entryFree id="n24976" type="main" key="irri^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irrigo</etym>, <sense id="n24976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrigating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (pulvinos) irrigationes abluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrigatione fluminis diluere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 81</bibl></cit>.—Also transf., <hi rend="ital">refreshment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrigation ossium tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrigator: <entryFree id="n24977" type="main" key="irri^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭgātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waterer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 95:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 95, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrigo: <entryFree id="n24978" type="main" key="irri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. inrigo</etym>, <sense id="n24978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> water or other liquids <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n24978.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amurcam ad arbores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in areas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres (plantis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 115</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24978.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24978.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptum Nilus irrigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fig.: Democritus, cujus fontibus Epicurus hortulos suos inrigavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera L. prati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24978.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circus Tiberi superfuso irrigatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pactolus irrigat culta auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 142</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24978.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrigat terram cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 44" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletu genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 441" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phoen. 441</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24978.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To supply with fluid</hi>: venas quae sub cute sunt. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:23:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 23, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24978.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24978.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cheer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: per aures pectus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol irrigat assidue caelum candore recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 282</bibl></cit>: per membra quietem, <cb n="IRRI" /> <hi rend="ital">to diffuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 908</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui placidam per membra quietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessos sopor irrigat artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut studiosi juvenes lectione severa irrigarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24978.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi> (com.): <cit><quote lang="la">irrigatus plagis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>beaten soundly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irriguus: <entryFree id="n24979" type="main" key="irri^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭgŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. in-riguus</etym>, <sense id="n24979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supplied with water.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24979.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24979.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-watered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irriguous; full of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swampy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio irrigua fontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl></cit> (al. rigua).—</sense><sense id="n24979.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">watering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irriguous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24979.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24979.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Permeating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pervading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:56" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 6 praef.</bibl></cit> 10.—</sense><sense id="n24979.6" n="B" level="2"> Corpus mero, <hi rend="ital">soaked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inrigatus multo venas nectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24979.7" n="C" level="2"> Carmen, <hi rend="ital">music produced by the water-organ</hi>, Auct. Aetnae, 295.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭ-gŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> </sense><sense id="n24979.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Overflowings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24979.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Swamps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marshes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflowed land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Euphrates) distrahitur ad inrigua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrimor: <entryFree id="n24980" type="hapax" key="irri_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīmor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>1. in-rimor</etym>, <sense id="n24980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to explore</hi>: incultos sinus, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 382, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrio: <entryFree id="n24981" type="main" key="irri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭo</orth>, v. hirrio.</entryFree>
irrisibilis: <entryFree id="n24982" type="hapax" key="irri_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>irrideo</etym>, <sense id="n24982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laughable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridiculous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 87:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 87, 7</bibl> (9).</sense></entryFree>
irrisio: <entryFree id="n24983" type="main" key="irri_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deriding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mocking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mockery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber a tali irrisione Socrates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrisio omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum irrisione audientium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrisive: <entryFree id="n24984" type="main" key="irri_si_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mockingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ironically</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 67</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:33" default="NO">13, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrisor: <entryFree id="n24985" type="main" key="irri_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a derider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mocker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoffer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus orationis et sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrisorius: <entryFree id="n24986" type="main" key="irri_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>irrisor</etym>, <sense id="n24986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scornful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versutia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 809</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ironically</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrisus: <entryFree id="n24987" type="main" key="irri_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from irrideo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24988" type="main" key="irri_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>irrideo</etym>, <sense id="n24988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scoffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mocking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mockery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrisu coarguere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrisum pueri sperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrisui esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a laughing-stock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostibus irrisui fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsisse eos non sine irrisu generis humani arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrisui haberi,</quote> <trans><tr>to be made a laughing-stock of</tr>, <tr>be made game of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab irrisu,</quote> <trans><tr>out of mockery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irritabilis: <entryFree id="n24989" type="main" key="irri_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. irrito</etym>. <sense id="n24989.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Easily excited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritabiles esse animos optimorum saepe hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus vatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 18</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n24989.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily exciting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irritabilitas: <entryFree id="n24990" type="main" key="irri_ta_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītābĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irritabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irritability</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doctr. Plat. 1, p. 11, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irritamen: <entryFree id="n24991" type="main" key="irri_ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītāmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. irrito</etym>, <sense id="n24991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provocative</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">opes, animi inritamen avari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 133</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (taurus) sua terribili petit inritamina cornu Poeniceas vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 523</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irritamentum: <entryFree id="n24992" type="main" key="irri_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provocative</hi> (not before the Aug. period, and most freq. in <number>plur.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: incitamentum, invitamentum, illecebra): irritamentis iras militum acuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certaminum equestrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">belli, non pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:7:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes, inritamenta malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris languentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of things, <hi rend="ital">a provocation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruction acting as a dam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fluvius) insulis inpactus, totidem incitatus inritamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irritate: <entryFree id="n24993" type="main" key="irri_ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. irrito, <sense id="n24993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
irritatio: <entryFree id="n24994" type="main" key="irri_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. irrito</etym>, <sense id="n24994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provocative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulant</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24994.1" n="I" level="1"> Physical: tenesmos est irritatio ultimae partis directi <cb n="IRRI" /> intestini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:142" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 142 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam edendi irritationes quasdam repertas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24994.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the feelings or passions. </sense><sense id="n24994.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad amicitiam naturalis irritatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum multum ... irritationem et iram facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 31, 38</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(feminae) nullis conviviorum irritationibus corruptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 19</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inesse irritationem animis commutandi sedes,</quote> <trans><tr>a restless desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24994.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">wrath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irritator: <entryFree id="n24995" type="main" key="irri_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. irrito</etym>, <sense id="n24995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum irritator accesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irritatrix: <entryFree id="n24996" type="main" key="irri_ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irritator</etym>, <sense id="n24996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who incites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Interpr. Ezech. 24, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irritatus: <entryFree id="n24997" type="main" key="irri_ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. 1. irrito <sense id="n24997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24998" type="main" key="irri_ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. irrito</etym>, <sense id="n24998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritatu suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrite: <entryFree id="n24999" type="main" key="irri^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭtē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. irritus <sense id="n24999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
irrito: <entryFree id="n25000" type="main" key="irri_to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrīto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n25000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> inritassis for inritaveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 298</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)/ris, e)re/qw, e)reqi/zw,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 342" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 342</bibl>, ed. 4</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exasperate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25000.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inritare dictum est proprie provocare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 31, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me inritassis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 298</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne si magis inritatus siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sum inritatus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vi inritare ferroque lacessere fortissimum virum auderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terra, ira irritata deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi simultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad necem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fera diluvies quietos Irritat amnes,</quote> <trans><tr>enrages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas,</quote> <trans><tr>to kindle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:649" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 649</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25000.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crabrones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos plebis fama ea ipsa inritaverat magis ad certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam, Sen. de Ira, 3, 8: infantiam ad discendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma meos irritat amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 75: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam per se pronam ad humanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps, qui delatores non castigat, irritat,</quote> <trans><tr>encourages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitium,</quote> <trans><tr>to hasten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tussim,</quote> <trans><tr>to excite</tr>, <tr>make worse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 2</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrī-tātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">excited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canem inritatam imitarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego his ejus verbis irritatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:9:2" default="NO">10, 9, 2</bibl>; id. praef. § 20.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an irritated manner;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25001" type="main" key="irri^to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. irritus</etym>, <sense id="n25001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invalidate</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 3, 12, 2.</sense></entryFree>
irritus: <entryFree id="n25002" type="main" key="irri^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inratus</etym>, <sense id="n25002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">invalid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25002.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25002.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Undecided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of no effect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod modo erat ratum, irritum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm, 4, 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum irritum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum pro irrito habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:146 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 146 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias rescindere et irritas facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque augur injusta, nefasta, vitiosa, dira, defixerit, inrita infectaque sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ab iis acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:696" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberii voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <trans><tr>of no significance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Remus aves irritas habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25002.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ineffectual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrata atque irrita esse omnia intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 273</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua dicta factaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua (Cassandrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 66: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:26" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <trans><tr>fruitless</tr>, <tr>infertile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 58, 79, § 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25002.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">that does</hi> or <hi rend="ital">undertakes a thing in vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to no purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without effect.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25002.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritus legationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit> <pb n="1003" /> <cb n="IRRU" /> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spei,</quote> <trans><tr>vainly hoping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:131" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 131</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25002.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">variis assultibus irritus urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit et e templis irrita turba domum,</quote> <trans><tr>without a response</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irriti legati remittuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum irritus rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedere irritum putebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: irritus qui habebatur, laudabatur, <hi rend="ital">good for nothing</hi>, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">nothingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthlessness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes ad irritum redacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes ad irritum cadens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria ad inritum revolvebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecidisse in inritum labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 53</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrita dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>useless words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">irrĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in vain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n25003" type="main" key="irri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. hirritus.</entryFree>
irroborasco: <entryFree id="n25004" type="main" key="irro_bo^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrōbŏrasco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n25004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [in-roborasco], <hi rend="ital">to acquire strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become confirmed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi significatio irroboravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrogatio: <entryFree id="n25005" type="main" key="irro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŏgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-rogatio</etym>, <sense id="n25005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imposing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjudicating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dupli vel quadrupli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:40:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 40, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrogo: <entryFree id="n25006" type="main" key="irro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŏgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (irrogassit for irrogaverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-rogo</etym>. <sense id="n25006.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To propose</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">against</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">leges privatis hominibus irrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privilegia tyrannica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42, 110</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">privilegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privilegia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25006.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to impose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum milium multam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui tributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:190" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 16:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id supplicii genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labori non plus irrogandum est, quam quod somno supererit,</quote> <trans><tr>no more is to be bestowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia dira in ipsos,</quote> <trans><tr>to exercise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
