irroro: <entryFree id="n25007" type="main" key="irro_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n25007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-roro], <hi rend="ital">to wet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moisten with dew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bedew.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25007.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctibus vas tegendum erit, ne irroretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum Auster irrorat,</quote> <trans><tr>brings dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25007.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquores Vestibus et capiti,</quote> <trans><tr>to besprinkle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:371" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquorem mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:302" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduis irroras flatibus annum (of the Zephyr),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrorat pestifer (aër) undis,</quote> <trans><tr>falls upon in dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:331" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae misero de corpore jactis irrorant foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 369</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo irrorat Aquarius anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleo viridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25007.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things not fluid: <cit><quote lang="la">patinae piper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:21" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis quietem, of sleep,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:355" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 355</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irroto: <entryFree id="n25008" type="main" key="irro^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŏto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-roto</etym>, <sense id="n25008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play</hi> "<hi rend="ital">ducks and drakes</hi>:" testam super undas (a boy's game, in which a shell or thin stone is thrown against the water in such a manner as to skip along the surface), <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrubesco: <entryFree id="n25009" type="main" key="irru^besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭbesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n25009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [in-rubesco], <hi rend="ital">to grow red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be reddened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sanguine ferrum irrubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:231" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 647</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haemachates sanguineis maculis irrubescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25009.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw a red light</hi> upon a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis ut mihi vultibus ignis irrubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irructo: <entryFree id="n25010" type="hapax" key="irructo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irructo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-ructo</etym>, <sense id="n25010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to belch into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrudis: <entryFree id="n25011" type="gloss" key="irru^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-rudis</etym>, <sense id="n25011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not raw</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrufo: <entryFree id="n25012" type="main" key="irru_fo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrūfo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inrufo</etym>, <sense id="n25012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make red</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107</bibl></cit>, n. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">barba facta irrufata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrugatio: <entryFree id="n25013" type="main" key="irru_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrūgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irrugo</etym>, <sense id="n25013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrinkling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 648</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrugio: <entryFree id="n25014" type="main" key="irru^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭgĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ĭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-rugio</etym>, <sense id="n25014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry loudly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrugo: <entryFree id="n25015" type="main" key="irru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrūgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-rugo</etym>, <sense id="n25015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wrinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make wrinkled.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25015.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25015.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:266" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrumatio: <entryFree id="n25016" type="main" key="irru^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭmātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irrumo</etym>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 21, 8</bibl>; for signif. see irrumo, I.</entryFree>
irrumator: <entryFree id="n25017" type="main" key="irru^ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭmātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who practises beastly obscenity</hi>, Firm. Math. <cb n="IRRU" /> 8, 20.— </sense><sense id="n25017.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a vile person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrumo: <entryFree id="n25018" type="main" key="irru^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ruma</etym>, <sense id="n25018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to extend the breast to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give suck;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n25018.1" n="I" level="1"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 36, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:50:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 50, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25018.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25018.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To treat in a foul</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shameful manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 28, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25018.4" n="B" level="2"> Irrumata unda, i. e. <hi rend="ital">defiled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:70:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 70, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irrumpibilis: <entryFree id="n25019" type="gloss" key="irrumpi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrumpĭbĭlis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/rrhktos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
irrumpo: <entryFree id="n25020" type="main" key="irrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrumpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>rūpi, ruptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n25020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-rumpo], <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burst</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rush in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25020.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25020.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cesso huc intro inrumpere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec inrumpo, quo non licet ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocunque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua irrumpens oceanus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam partem hostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medios hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum telis ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare in aversa Asiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oct. 732" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oct. 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem irrumpentem in sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:167" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 167</bibl></cit>: se in curiam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 263, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrumpentis in curiam turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuos in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 441</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25020.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin oppidum irrumperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 13</bibl></cit>. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">domum alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 111, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interiora domus irrumpit limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:79" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuam arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:692" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 692</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25020.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:378" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:365" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacris muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:368" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25020.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum irrumpere nostri conarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad primum gemitum,</quote> <trans><tr>upon the first groan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit et irrupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:453" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscit hostes pluribus agminibus inrupturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25020.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rush in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon; to intrude upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo in Academiam irruperit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines in animos per corpus irrumpunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus patrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuries in domum irrupit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 42, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostrum fletum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitates, quae ad me irruperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrumpet adulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: grammatici ad prosopopoeias usque ... irrumpunt, <hi rend="ital">venture upon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">presume to teach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>boldly inquire the will of the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebe, hanc dignare irrumpere mentem,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter</tr>, <tr>inspire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:341" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 10, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 470</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:167" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremique fragor convexa irrupit Olympi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 478</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25020.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 13, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutum, Lact. de Ira Dei, 14, 6: legem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irruo: <entryFree id="n25021" type="main" key="irru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-ruo</etym>, <sense id="n25021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">force one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an attack upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25021.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico equites jubet dexterā inruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Ussing, inducere): quam mox inruimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irruimus ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aedis alienas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediam aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super collum alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to embrace eagerly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:46:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 46, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super gladium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25021.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25021.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximos agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodopen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 77, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has terras, of waters,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25021.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ne ille huc prorsus se irruat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25021.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to force one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter eagerly into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienas possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecunda debet esse translatio, ut deducta esse in alienum locum, non irruisse videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 41, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in odium alicujus et offensionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to incur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inruente in se Spiritu Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta sunt circumspicienda, ne quid offendas, ne quo irruas,</quote> <trans><tr>make a hasty blunder in speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 301</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25021.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 60</bibl></cit>. <cb n="IS" /></sense></entryFree>
irruptio: <entryFree id="n25022" type="main" key="irrupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irruptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>irrumpo</etym>, <sense id="n25022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bursting in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an irruption.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25022.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">irruptionem facere in popinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25022.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an invasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incursion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi irruptio facta nulla sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: Gallorum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 31.</sense></entryFree>
irruptus: <entryFree id="n25023" type="main" key="irruptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irruptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an irruption</hi> (late Lat.), Fab. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gord. Fulg. Aet. Mund. 11, p. 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25024" type="main" key="irruptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irruptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from irrumpo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25025" type="hapax" key="irruptus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irruptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-rumpo</etym>, <sense id="n25025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbroken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsevered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
irrutilo: <entryFree id="n25026" type="main" key="irru^ti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irrŭtĭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-rutilo</etym>, <sense id="n25026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glimmer redly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be ruddy</hi>, Ambros. de Isaac et Anim. 7, 60; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. Dav. 8, 45 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
irtiola: <entryFree id="n25027" type="main" key="irti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">irtĭŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">irc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vitis), <sense id="n25027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of vine and grapes in Umbria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
irus: <entryFree id="n25028" type="main" key="I_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=iros,</foreign> <sense id="n25028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a beggar in the house of Ulysses at Ithaca;</hi> used proverbially to denote <hi rend="ital">a poor man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Irus est subito, qui modo Croesus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iron,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 747</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 39</bibl> (4, 4, 17): <cit><quote lang="la">Iro pauperior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 41, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 39, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:77:1" default="NO">6, 77, 1</bibl>.—In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:415" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 415</bibl>, binominis, <hi rend="ital">double-named</hi>, because he was named Arnaeus by his mother.</sense></entryFree>
is: <entryFree id="n25029" type="main" key="is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">is</orth>, <itype>ĕa, id</itype> (<gen>m.</gen> eis, C. I. L. 1, 198; <gen>n.</gen> it, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 875 al.</bibl>, and freq. in MSS. of Plaut.), <sense id="n25029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ējus (old form eiius, C. I. L. 3, 1365 et saep.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, 4, 18, p. 545</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also etius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 1276 al.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">scanned ĕius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 51</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 374</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 109: eius, monosyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 7</bibl> et saep.; <case>dat.</case> ĕï, in ante-class. poetry often ēi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:300" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 300</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eiei, C. I. L. 1, 198, 12 al.: eei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Neap.</author> 2423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iei, C. I. L. 1, 205, col. 2, 12 al.: ei, monosyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 138</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:82:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 82, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 7, 5, 21, p. 740</bibl>; Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 374</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 582</bibl></cit>; <gen>f.</gen> eae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 77</bibl> Ritschl; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 46, 1</bibl>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:28:51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 28, 51</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> im for eum, Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 17, p. 107 sq.</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103</bibl>; also em, Tab. XII., tab. 1, fr. 1.— <hi rend="ital">Plur. nom. m.</hi> ĕi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 23</bibl>; but in the MSS. ii; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Neap.</author> 2423, 8</bibl></cit>: iei, C. I. L. 1, 185; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:1:2 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 1, 2 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but ī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:158 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 158 al.</bibl>; v. Ritschl prol. p. 98; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> eum for eorum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 582, 2</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> eīs or iīs, also īs, C. I. L. 1, 198, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 140</bibl>, and freq. in MSS.: <cit><quote lang="la">eis, monosyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:59 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 59 al.</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 934</bibl>: ieis, C. I. L. 1, 204, col. 1, 5 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">old form also ībus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 17</bibl>: ĭbus, Titin. et Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 486</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 88</bibl>; cf. S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>; v. Lachm. l. l.; <gen>f.</gen> eābus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 152</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 7, 3, 11, p. 733</bibl>; v. more on these forms, Neue, Formenl. 2, 191-196), <hi rend="ital">pron. demonstr.</hi> [root i-; Sanscr. itas; hence, i-ha, here; cf. i-bi, i-ta, i-dem, etc.]. </sense><sense id="n25029.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it; this</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that</hi> man, woman, thing. </sense><sense id="n25029.2" n="A" level="2"> Referring to something already mentioned, in gen. </sense><sense id="n25029.3" n="1" level="3"> Referring to the <hi rend="ital">third person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit quidam senex Mercator: navem is fregit apud Andrum insulam: Is obiit mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit mihi obviam tuus puer: is mihi litteras abs te reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objecit ut probrum nobiliori, quod is, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.4" n="2" level="3"> Of the <hi rend="ital">first person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me credidi Homini docto rem mandare: is lapidi mando maxumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia is feci, qui sodalis Dolabellae eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n25029.5" n="3" level="3"> Of the <hi rend="ital">second person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui magister equitum fuisse tibi viderere, is per municipia cucurristi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n25029.7" n="1" level="3"> In connection with a <hi rend="ital">noun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea re, quia turpe sit, faciendum non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res ut est Helvetiis enuntiata, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ob eam rem tribueret, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen est Arar ... id flumen, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: sub id tempus, Liv. <pb n="1004" /> <cb n="IS" /> 43, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus disputationis sententias memoriae mandavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante eam diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea tempestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam urbem is rex condidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.8" n="2" level="3"> When <hi rend="ital">is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">id</hi> would stand in the same case with the <hi rend="ital">relative</hi> it is usually omitted; when the <hi rend="ital">relative</hi> precedes, it is sometimes employed for emphasis: <cit><quote lang="la">male se res habet, cum, quod virtute effici debet, id temptatur pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25029.9" n="3" level="3"> Connected with <hi rend="ital">que</hi> and <hi rend="ital">quidem</hi>, it gives prominence to a preceding idea: <cit><quote lang="la">cum una legione eaque vacillante,</quote> <trans><tr>and that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inprimis nobis sermo isque multus de te fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus dolor humanus is quidem, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula et ea sempiterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa flagitiis merces, nec ea parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25029.10" n="4" level="3"> It is sometimes used instead of the <hi rend="ital">reflexive pronoun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii persuadent Rauracis, ut una cum iis (for secum) proficiscantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar etiam privatas injurias ultus est, quod ejus soceri avum Tigurini interfecerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25029.11" n="5" level="3"> It is sometimes placed, for greater emphasis, after a <hi rend="ital">relative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem, quae fortunis vestris imminebat, eam ... se fecisse commemorat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 35, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem novam conditam vi et armis, jure eam legibusque de integro condere parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25029.12" n="C" level="2"> <itype>Id</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, to designate an idea in the most general manner, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> (thing, fact, thought, circumstance, etc.). </sense><sense id="n25029.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando verba vana ad id locorum fuerint, rebus standum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>hitherto</tr>, <tr>till now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad id (sc. tempus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id quod natura cogeret, i. e. death,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>at that time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 10</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id aetatis,</quote> <trans><tr>at that age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:37:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 37, § 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.14" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n25029.15" n="(a)" level="5"> Id, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for that reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id misera maesta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idne estis auctores mihi?</quote> <trans><tr>do you advise me to that?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.16" n="(b)" level="5"> Id genus = ejus generis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid id genus scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.17" n="(g)" level="5"> Ad id, <hi rend="ital">for that purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id quod sua quemque mala cogebant, evocati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: ad id quod = praeterquam quod, <hi rend="ital">besides that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul ad id, quod, etc., tunc quoque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 37, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 62, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 45, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25029.18" n="(d)" level="5"> In id, <hi rend="ital">to that end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id fide a rege accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) In eo est, <hi rend="ital">it is gone so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is at that pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad me de Lentulo scribis, non est in eo,</quote> <trans><tr>it is not come to that</tr>, <tr>is not so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam in eo esset, ut in muros evaderet miles,</quote> <trans><tr>when the soldiers were just on the point of scaling the walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 22, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl>: in eo est, also, <hi rend="ital">it consists in that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depends upon that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum in eo est tectorium, ut sit concinnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus omnis oratio versata est in eo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic velim enitare quasi in eo mihi sint omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Ex eo, <hi rend="ital">from that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen ex eo, quod eam voluptatem videtur amplexari saepe vehementius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9</bibl></cit>. — (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Cum eo, ut (with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">with the condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stipulation that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Eo, adverbially, with the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by so much;</hi> but frequently to be expressed in English by <hi rend="ital">the</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 9</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.19" n="D" level="2"> Sometimes <hi rend="ital">is</hi> refers to the foll. substantive, instead of to the preceding relative: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vectigalia locasset, ea rata locatio (for eorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea libera conjectura est (for de hac re),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pars major erit, eo stabitur consilio (for ejus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existit ea, quae gemma dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes, for emphasis, it is placed before the relative quod, to represent a thought or clause: <cit><quote lang="la">ratus, id quod negotium poscebat, Jugurtham venturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 51, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ille hoc ingenio potuisset, sive, id quod constaret, Platonis studiosus audiendi fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nos, id quod debet, nostra patria delectat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, id quod facile factu fuit, vi armisque superassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 30</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">id quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id de quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 9</bibl></cit>. — It is thus apparently pleonastic after substantives: Octavio Mamilio—is longe princeps Latini nominis erat ...—ei <cb n="ISCH" /> Mamilio filiam nuptum dat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum, quem habebat, eum defigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 58, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 1</bibl>.—It is rarely pleonastic after the relative: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ne id facere posses, idcirco dixeram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 79</bibl></cit> dub. (B. and K. bracket id). — </sense><sense id="n25029.20" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it; that man</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the man</hi> (<hi rend="ital">woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that one</hi>, as a correlative to qui: <cit><quote lang="la">si is, qui erit adductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is mihi profecto servus spectatus satis, Cui dominus curae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>. And also in the first person: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tibi scribo ... is, qui flevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25029.21" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of such a sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum jam rediit locum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim tu is es, qui, quid sis, nescias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque ego is in illum sum, quem tu me esse vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is eram natus ... ut potuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen eas cenas quaero, ut magnae reliquiae fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causae sunt ejus modi, ut de earum jure dubium esse non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim credo is vir iste, ut civitatis nomen sua auctoritate sustineat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 15, 34</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25029.22" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of so high a degree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Mescinius ea mecum consuetudine conjunctus est, quod mihi quaestor fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25029.23" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕā</orth> (sc. parte, viā, etc.), <hi rend="ital">on that side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by that way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eā proxime accedi poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera muniit: effecit ut eā elephantus ornatus ire posset, quā antea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam comperit, transitum eā non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 26, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 27, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al. — </sense><sense id="n25029.24" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕō</orth>, v. 2. eo.</sense></entryFree>
isaac: <entryFree id="n25030" type="main" key="Isaac"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isaac</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Isac</orth>), <gen>m.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Isaacus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Abraham</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 748; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 17, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isacia: <entryFree id="n25031" type="main" key="Isacia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isacia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island opposite Velia</hi> (v. Oenotrides), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isaeus: <entryFree id="n25032" type="main" key="I_saeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)isai=os.</foreign> <sense id="n25032.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian orator of Chalcis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor of Demosthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25032.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contemporary of the younger Pliny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also a Grecian orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isagoge: <entryFree id="n25033" type="main" key="i_sa^go_ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsăgōgē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">īsăgōga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)sagwgh/,</foreign> <sense id="n25033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an introduction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isagogicus: <entryFree id="n25034" type="main" key="i_sa^go_gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsăgōgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>isagoge</etym>, <sense id="n25034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">introductory</hi>: commentarius, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isaias: <entryFree id="n25035" type="main" key="I_saias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsaias</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Esaias</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the prophet Isaiah</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 195</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 5, 524.—Form Esaias, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Carm. 6, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isara: <entryFree id="n25036" type="main" key="I^sa^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Gaul that falls into the Rhone</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Isère</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 399</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isatis: <entryFree id="n25037" type="main" key="i_sa^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsătis</orth>, <itype>is, and ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/satis,</foreign> <sense id="n25037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb with a milky juice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used in healing wounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 25, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isauri: <entryFree id="n25038" type="main" key="I^sauri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsauri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Asiatic tribe between Pamphylia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Lycaonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Isaurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">of their country,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25038.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25038.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsau-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Isauri</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25038.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsaurĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Isaurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 23, § 94</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsaurĭcus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of P. Servilius Vatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who conquered the Isaurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25038.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsaurus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Isaurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:593" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 593</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
isaurus: <entryFree id="n25039" type="main" key="I^saurus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Foglia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 406</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n25040" type="main" key="I^saurus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭsaurus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Isauri, II. C.</entryFree>
ischaemon: <entryFree id="n25041" type="greek" key="ischaemon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ischaemon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/sxaimon,</foreign> <sense id="n25041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of styptic herb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 45, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:131" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 82, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ischia: <entryFree id="n25042" type="greek" key="ischi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ischĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)sxi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n25042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hipjoints</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hips</hi> (Lat. coxae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ischiacus: <entryFree id="n25043" type="greek" key="ischi^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ischĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)sxiako/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the gout in the hip.</hi> — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ischĭăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ischiadicus: <entryFree id="n25044" type="greek" key="ischi^a^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ischĭădĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)sxiadiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the gout in the hip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ischiadic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <trans><tr>pains in the hip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 27, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 26</bibl></cit>. — <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">one who has the hip-gout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 4, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:2 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ischias: <entryFree id="n25045" type="greek" key="ischi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ischĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)sxia/s.</foreign> <sense id="n25045.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> <cb n="ISME" /> <hi rend="ital">hip-gout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sciatica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 16, § 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25045.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an herb said to be good for the hip-gout;</hi> called also leucacantha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 16, 18, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ischomache: <entryFree id="n25046" type="main" key="Ischo^ma^che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ischŏmăchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)isxoma/xh,</foreign> <sense id="n25046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Atracius</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Atrax;</hi> called also <hi rend="ital">Hippodamīa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at whose wedding with Pirithoüs the conflict arose between the Centaurs and Lapithæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ischuria: <entryFree id="n25047" type="greek" key="ischu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ischūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)sxouri/a,</foreign> <sense id="n25047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stoppage of urine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ischury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iselasticus: <entryFree id="n25048" type="greek" key="i_se^lasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īsĕlastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)selastiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n25048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a public entrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen or agon,</quote> <trans><tr>a public contest</tr>, <tr>the victors in which were conducted home in triumphal procession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 119 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl></cit>; Vitr. praef. 9.—</sense><sense id="n25048.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">īsĕlastĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the reward presented to such a victor by the emperor</hi>, Trajan. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iseum: <entryFree id="n25049" type="main" key="I_se_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/iseion,</foreign> <sense id="n25049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the temple of Isis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isiacus: <entryFree id="n25050" type="main" key="I_si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Isis, II.</entryFree>
isicium: <entryFree id="n25051" type="main" key="isi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">isĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. insicium.</entryFree>
isidorus: <entryFree id="n25052" type="main" key="I_si^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsĭdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Isidore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of several celebrated writers of antiquity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and particularly</hi>, </sense><sense id="n25052.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A geographer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25052.2" n="B" level="2"> Isidorus Hispalensis, <hi rend="ital">archbishop of Hispalis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the seventh century of our era</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> XX. libri Originum. — </sense><sense id="n25052.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cynic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who rebuked Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25052.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Tertia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isidotus: <entryFree id="n25053" type="main" key="Isi^do^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isĭdŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isigonus: <entryFree id="n25054" type="main" key="Isi^go^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isĭgŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
isiondensis: <entryFree id="n25055" type="main" key="Isiondensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Isiondensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n25055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Isionda</hi> (in the southwest of Pisidia), <hi rend="ital">Isiondian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
isis: <entryFree id="n25056" type="main" key="I_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and ĭdis. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=isis,</foreign> <sense id="n25056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Egyptian goddess Isis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 772</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 158</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25056.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25056.2" n="1" level="3"> Isidis crinis, <hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, Juba ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 52, § 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25056.3" n="2" level="3"> Isidis sidus, <hi rend="ital">the planet Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25056.4" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)isiako/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Isis</hi>: conjectores, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">focus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isiacae sacraria lenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:488" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 488</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsĭă-cus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a priest of Isis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 29, § 53 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
isium: <entryFree id="n25057" type="main" key="I_si_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īsīum</orth>, v. Iseum.</entryFree>
ismael: <entryFree id="n25058" type="main" key="Ismael"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismaël</orth>, <itype>ēlis</itype>, or <itype>indecl.</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Abraham</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s son by Hagar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ishmael</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 16, 15</bibl> sqq.; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Ismaël, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">-ēlis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismăēlītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant of Ishmael</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 37, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ismarus: <entryFree id="n25059" type="main" key="Isma^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismăra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ismaros,</foreign> <sense id="n25059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain on the southern coast of Thrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ismara propter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvat Ismara Baccho conserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:685" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 685</bibl>.—Form Ismarus: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodope miratur et Ismarus Orphea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25059.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the city at the foot of the mountain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the territory belonging to it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Idas pater, et patria Ismara mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Castra decem annorum, Ciconum manus, Ismara capta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> (4, 11), 25.—</sense><sense id="n25059.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismărĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ismarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ismarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 33</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n25059.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ismarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ismarian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:410" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Polymestor</tr>, <tr>king of Thrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:530" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <trans><tr>the valley where Orpheus drew the wild beasts after him by the sound of his lyre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit> (3, 4, 6).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25060" type="main" key="Isma^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ismărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Lydian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
